Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Software Development Platform Engineer will develop (code/program), test, debug SQL queries and data programs supporting both internal and external technically-challenging business requirements (sophisticated transformations, high data volume), as well as provide operational support for the underlying services and infrastructure of our big data platforms. Develop solutions capable of processing millions of events per second and multi-billions of events per day, providing both a real time and historical view into the operation of Comcast’s wide array of systems. Design collection and enrichment system components for quality, timeliness, scale and reliability. Work on dedication real time data stores and a relevant historical data stores using best-of-breed and industry-leading technology. Build platforms that allow others to design, develop, and apply sophisticated statistical methods and Machine Intelligence algorithms, fostering self-service capabilities and ease of use across the entire Technology, Product, Xperience (TPX) organization landscape and beyond!


The dx Team is building the core components needed to drive the next generation of data platforms and data processing capability at Comcast. Building data products, identifying trouble spots, and optimizing the overall user experience is a challenge that can only be met with a robust architecture capable of providing insights that would otherwise be drowned in an ocean of data. In order to provide access to data in Comcast’s platforms, dx is building an enterprise Query Fabric based on open-source and commercial Presto technologies.

This Platform Engineering role will include a mixture of DevOps responsibilities, chipping in to the software development of the Query Fabric Platform, new software features and defect resolution, day-to-day platform operations and support, and other platforms/technologies (e.g. caching and web services) as needed. You will have the opportunity to make contributions to the Presto codebase as well as other open source projects, and you will be expected to support hundreds (and eventually thousands) of internal customers in their use of this platform.

Success in this role is best enabled by a broad mix of skills and interests ranging from traditional distributed systems software engineering prowess to the multidisciplinary field of data science.

This Denver-based position will complement the existing dx Open Egress team based in several locations across the U.S., and India and expected to grow as adoption of the Query Fabric grows.
Core Responsibilities
Participate in the development and/or deployment of components and infrastructure supporting big data platforms
Support platform capabilities that analyze extensive amounts of data both in real-time and batch processing
Facilitate the deployment of prototype ideas for new tools, products and services and the environments that support them
Employ meticulous continuous delivery practices handled under an agile software development approach
Ensure a quality transition to production and confirmed production operation of the platforms
Enhance our DevOps practices to deploy and operate our systems
Automate and streamline our operations and processes
Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations
Fix and resolve issues in our development, test and production environments
Analyzes and resolves data integration needs
Consults with and supports customer integration needs demonstrating our platforms
Evaluates and plans software designs, test results and technical manuals using Big Data (Hadoop) ecosystem
Reviews literature, current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects in the Data Egress/Access domain
Experience with DevOps tools (GitHub, Jira) and methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Test Driven Development)
Experience with a variety of relational and NoSQL database, Teradata, and other large Data Warehouse environment access capabilities
Exposure to data integration and storage in AWS - S3, Lambda, Glue Crawlers, Data Pipelines
Exposure to Hadoop ecosystem tools like Spark, YARN, HDFS, Hive, Sqoop, understanding of systems performance data (collection, monitoring, analysis)
Exposure to CI/CD, containerization and test-driven development (TDD)
Exposure to data loads in Databricks
Programs new software using Java or Python and Shell Scripts
Deep knowledge of SQL and data sourcing technologies such as Informatica.
Supervise job performances, file system/disk-space management, cluster and database connectivity, log files, management of backup/security and fixing various user issues
Edits and reviews technical requirements documentation
Displays knowledge of software engineering methodologies, concepts, skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty (like Data Egress)
Displays knowledge of, and ability to apply, process software design and redesign skills
Displays in-depth knowledge of, and ability to apply, project management skills
Works independently, assumes responsibility for job development and training, researches and resolves questions and problems, requests supervisor input and keeps supervisor advised required
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as vital
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned


Familiarity with MPP Databases (massively parallel processing) is a requirement
Teradata or Oracle or MS SQL or MySQL
Java 8+ or Python, Shell Scripts, SQL
Experience with hybrid Linux infrastructure footprints – cloud hosts (e.g. AWS EC2 instances), Virtual hosts (e.g. VMWare), and local data center hosts
“Basic” knowledge will not be enough here.
Preferred Technologies
Scala, Python, R, UC4, Ranger, Kafka, AWS, AWS Lambda, BTEQ, Spark, Sqoop, gRPC, Apache Thrift, HTTP2.0
HTTP, REST
OAuth 2 with OpenID, RPC
Hive and table/file formats
S3, Glue

Job Summary As a Senior Software Development and Systems Integration Engineer on the Enterprise IT Infrastructure team, you will be responsible for all aspects of the plan, build, run and maintenance of our pro-active monitoring tools and data centers as well as adding intelligence to systems and data to deliver practical solution for the business. The team is a small and fast-moving team of best-in-class authorities who are innovating in pro-active monitoring technology delivery for Comcast Business Service Assurance. We are a team that flourishes with big challenges, results, quality, and agility.
Job Description

On this team you will not only be an evangelist for tools and technology the business partners rely on, but also get exposure to the latest industry solutions.


Designing, solutioning and implementing the business /product features
Be the SME (and the Go To person) for the Monitoring tools/solutions.
Writing high quality production-ready application code.
Pairing and collaborating with peers.

Participating in joint design and architecture sessions with Network engineering team
Be part of our Agile development team and participate in bi-weekly sprints

Building effective Continuous integration, near time Delivery & Deployment model with confirmed operations monitoring capabilities.
Establish operations excellency by reducing the MTTR and measuring the platform resiliency against the Error Budget
Ensuring timely remediation for keeping the platforms & apps secured.
An eye for strong automation and Toil reduction focus
Operating and supporting production environments (including on-call support once out of each month which is infrequent)

Ability to navigate to custom and machine logs to triage and drive issues resolution will be very useful
facility with command command-line utilities; familiarity with system administration tools and concepts a plus.

Experience with high-scale, distributed web service development (hands-on experience with RESTful/web services).
Understanding of Machine learning principles and technology.

Experience working with automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Terraform.
Understanding of TCP/IP networking protocols (SNMPv3, ICMP, BGP…) and data formats like HTTP, JDBC, JSON, YAML.

Job_Description:

Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. Job Summary The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers.


As a Comcast Network Engineer, you will join an experienced team of engineers responsible for the infrastructure and core routing design of Converged Regional Area Network (CRAN). Additional duties will include performance engineering, real time analysis and optimization of the existing CRAN. Each Comcast CRAN combines the following services – high speed data, video, voice, and business services - onto a single converged IP infrastructure. Our network is comprised of approximately 15,000 routers, four vendors, and dozens of platforms supporting Residential and Business Services customers spanning 28 regional networks across the nation.


Service provider experience
Very Solid understanding of IP routing/switching (ISIS, OSPF, BGP, MPLS)
Solid scripting skills required, in any of the following languages: Python, Perl, Unix, PHP, and MySQL
Proficient in the understanding and practical application of programming the network versus configuring networks
Solid grasp of IPv4, IPv6, Multicast and QOS
Very organized individual with the ability to handle multiple projects, lead and/or participate on multiple project teams
Proven business skills to interact with internal business units and external vendors
Additional experience in server-based technology, such as Microsoft and Unix is a plus
Prior network engineering and support experience. Generally, requires 5+ years of related experience.
BS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or other technology related field


Working with Open Source. Both as a user and community contributor.
Virtualization
Software Defined Networking, network automation, data-plane programming.
Quagga, Bird, FD.io VPP, FBOSS, Wedge, Cisco Lindt, Kafka.
Network telemetry, key-value & JSON document stores, time-series databases.
Distributed systems


Engineering support CRAN services – high speed data, video, voice, and business services products.
Contribute efforts to automate internal processes and tools to improve overall consistency in routine engineering task execution.
Drive towards an environment and architecture where programming networks can replace a model of traditional network configuration.

Participate and/or lead assigned interdepartmental technical projects.

Develops practices and procedures for network installation, maintenance, and operation.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.
Job Summary Network Design Engineer works for and under the general direction of the Manager, Network Engineering. Primary responsibilities include the design of custom enterprise network solutions for our customers, troubleshooting, installing, implementing and administering network systems, and providing Tier IV Help Desk escalation support. Analyzes capacity issues and develops capacity planning models. Responsible for ensuring planned maintenance and testing activities are executed and for developing guidelines for network configuration and security standards.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
This position works under limited supervision.
Design and implementation of custom network solutions for existing and potential customers. Follows best-practice industry standards to provide a network design which is functional, scalable and secure.
Supports the Solutions Architect group to design, document and implement customer pilots and provide support for customer testing as required while in the pilot phase of the sales process.
Provides network engineering support to Sales organization as required.
Provides Tier IV escalation support to Help Desk. Troubleshoots, diagnoses and resolves customer network issues. When applicable, recommends changes to remediate any network deficiencies to enhance network performance.
Researches, evaluates and provides recommendations for new hardware and software solutions, to stay current with new technology and market trends and future requirements.
Position requires participation of a rotating “on call” schedule to provide support for our business and customers.
Creates technical presentations as needed, presenting to various audiences (both internal and external) with all levels of technical knowledge.
Develops, documents and maintains processes and procedures related to design, implementation, maintenance and operations of various complex customer networks.
Follows and enforces documented processes and procedures to meet established compliance requirements.
Analyzes customer bandwidth requirements and system interdependencies as required. Develops capacity planning models to meet customer’s future needs.
Perform other tasks as requested by the Sr. Manager, Network Engineering

B.A. or B.S. Degree in a technical field from an accredited college or university.
5+ years of experience in network design, implementation, installation, maintenance and troubleshooting of complex networks.
Equivalent combination of education and experience considered.
CCNP, JNCIP, FNCSP(NSE4), CCVP, CCSP Certification or equivalent on-the-job experience considered
Strong working knowledge of various Vendor routers, switches, firewalls and wireless devices to include; Cisco, Meraki, Fortinet, Juniper, Aerohive, Airtight and Cradlepoint


MPLS, Frame-Relay, PPP, ISDN, T1
High Availability protocols such as; HSRP, VRRP, GLBP
IP Routing protocols to include; RIPv1, RIPv2, OSPF, BGP, EIGRP, Policy Routing
Tunneling protocols to include; GRE, IPSec, DMVPN, IWAN
QOS, Traffic Policing and Shaping
ACLs, AAA, TACACS+, RADIUS, SNMP, DHCP
Switch VLANs, VTP, STP
VoIP, SIP and PRI trunking
Wireless Networking
Understanding of VoIP, SIP and PRI tecn
Understanding of various network tools to include WhatsUp Gold, SolarWinds Orion, Cisco CCE, Cisco Prime, FortiManager, FortiAnalyzer, Wireshark or Netscout
Understanding of various compliance requirements, to include, but not limited to, PCI DSS, HIPAA, SOC a plus
Organized individual with the ability to manage multiple projects or tasks.
Strong technical documentation skills, to include creating network diagrams, operations and maintenance procedures, and technical presentations.
Strong verbal skills, to include technical presentations to all levels of technical expertise.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. Job Summary The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers.
Job Description


The primary responsibility of this position isadministration of SevOne and SevOne Data Insight portal applications.


Working with internal and external users to address their data collection and access needs
Supporting consumers of published and streamed data.
Consulting with SevOne Support to determine the most effective solutions
Maintaining and upgrading SevOne NMS and DI Portal applications


Experience withSevOne, Spectrum or other Network Management System
Understanding and usage of the SNMP Protocol, MIBs and OIDs


Experience with scripting (unix, python)
Knowledge of Kafka streaming
Knowledge of cloud technologies, Docker


The Smart Network Platform (SNP) Organization is seeking an individual to lead the integration and administration of our third-party Network Management Systems (NMSs). You will participate in determining strategy for third party NMS usage, hardware and software resource planning, and administration of these systems.

The team is responsible for the administration and operation of network monitoring platforms such as SevOne and Spectrum. These platforms provide visibility to all operational data for network devices in the Comcast network which is utilized by internal and external business users. The collected network device data is used directly by the platforms and is also published for consumption by multiple downstream systems.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a Mobile Engineer on the PlayerPlatform team, you will develop client-side libraries that are used by millions of people to stream Live, OnDemand, and Recorded content on their mobile devices. Player Platform is a native SDK that powers the video playback experience in Xfinity TV, Contour2, and FreeRange TV mobile apps. It provides a video player that integrates with our video streaming, content protection (DRM), advertisement, emergency alert, and real-time analytics services. Player Platform strives to provide a high quality, consistent playback experience across all the applications we run on.
Job Description
Who does the mobile engineer work with?
PlayerPlatform software engineers collaborate with industry experts from many subject areas: software architects, mobile application engineers, big data scientists, and various video streaming technologists. Every day, you will be working on a small scrum team that consists of product owners, software engineers, automation engineers, and quality assurance engineers. You will need to work closely with other technical teams internal and external to Comcast VIPER.

What are some exciting problems you’ll be working on?
Comcast manages an enormous amount of on-demand videos and thousands of linear channels. In order to support video playback of all of these different types of content, you will be developing new solutions to support our business as well as improve our customer experience. These features include picture in picture, casting, thumbnail scrubbing, and instant video startup. You will be working on tangible features that are used by millions of Comcast customers.

Where can you make an impact?
Your code will be responsible for all IP video playback streaming that is done at Comcast. It will be run on customers’ devices millions of times a week and will be the primary Comcast product that they get along with. You can help improve our video playback experience by developing the most stable, the highest quality video player in the industry. You’ll be working with the brightest minds in Comcast building a video platform that will power Comcast for years to come. You will drive the future of the IP video industry.


Build clean API’s for video playback on mobile devices.

Build reusable Android software components.

Design and implement end to end components related to video playback.

Analyze, optimize, and improve the code base.

Regular and consistent attendance.

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


2+ years software development experience with some experience in Android application development

Strong Java programming skills, Kotlin a strong plus

Knowledge Agile software development using continuous integration and deployment practices

Good understanding of OO & functional paradigms

Ability to prioritize and organize effectively

Willingness to accept mentorship with a desire to grow your skillsets and ability as an engineer and advise other engineering team members

Analytical and troubleshooting abilities

Bonus - any experience with video or the ExoPlayer open source project.

The VIPER team is an organization within Comcast’s grander Technology Product and Experience organization (TPX) which supports the Product Management, Research & Development, Engineering and Operations for Comcast’s Elite Video Experiences in use by Comcast and Syndicated Partners. We support both legacy QAM Video Delivery and the Next Generation IP Video Platform infrastructure from Content Acquisition to the Player consuming experiences we control the end-to-end Video delivery platforms. These platforms deliver video for live linear, video on-demand and cloud DVR services consumed by more than 20 million customers both in-home and out of home on stb’s, connected tv, mobile and desktop products.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.
Job Summary Responsible for being the escalation point of contact for all high level break/fix and maintenance issues or events for the OC. Provides subject matter expertise for CRAN, CMTS, transport, Video, CDV, HSI and works closely with the engineering teams. Performs a variety of highly complex analytical duties in the planning development, testing and evaluation of Comcast's network. Responds to escalations and resolves issues that arise from hardware and software failures. Manages network tuning, performance and designs strategies and makes recommends to improve network performance.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Performs a variety of highly complex analytical duties in the planning, development, testing and evaluation of Comcast's network, including CRAN, CMTS and the IP platform and Video platform. Works closely with engineering and national teams on network operations to ensure proper and efficient operations of the network.
Measures volume and performance of the network traffic; identifies utilization and performance issues; designs strategies and recommendations to improve network performance. Provides necessary support for additions and changes.
Devises and implements strategies for solving network issues or increasing network performance, including the development and production of network system documentation and instructional and procedural manuals for other employees to utilize in order to resolve problems or make network improvements. Supports all the OC tools and alarms, analyze systems needs and determines priority of devices attached to the network.
Ensures the availability of networking services; studies, evaluates, analyzes and monitors the network to determine problem areas and/or areas of concern. Monitors and isolates outages and impairments. Ensures that server databases and other related resources are properly maintained and devises strategies to improve performance of the network.
Provides subject matter expertise for all network equipment, technical training and support to other operational groups. Updates code and software to ensure proper system performance.
Engineer 2 performing Network Desk duties performs the following: Determines if the network, or a portion of the network, needs to be shut down to resolve complex issues. Provides technical support for the capacity and utilization reporting and tuning across the product lines. Tests, monitors and analyzes the network to isolate outages across all product lines. Performs port turn ups and downs on CRAN aligned to the agreed to demark matrix. Develops changes and improvements in the network including re-routing of traffic. Provisions DWDM and CWDM circuits.
Engineer 2 performing Video Desk duties performs the following: Participates in the review of video failures, as appropriate and provides feedback to prevent future occurrences within the established post mortem process. Accountable for video configuration audits and adherence to the golden configuration. Supports national desk for DSG and 2way conduit applications. Supports all channel migration from the headend to the CRAN. Supports all SD and HD channel launches. Uses all available tools to monitor and isolate IP video outages and impairments. Maintains all IP video delivery devices (i.e. RPD's, OM-1000's and NC-1500's). Performs MPEG troubleshooting through a variety of highly complex analytical duties in the testing and evaluation of Comcast's network. Provides operational support for the DAC and DNCS in conjunction with engineering and AVS. Directs Headend Technician(s) in troubleshooting network issues for video, ADS and Switched Digital video.
Devises modulation changes to the CHSI QAMs. Acts as the SME in isolating problems between the CMTS, transport distribution and subscriber Modem equipment. Ensures the CHSI network is optimally engineered. Analyzes and troubleshoots networks such as: CHSI Infrastructure, CRAN/CMTS and transport. Designs, conducts and interprets database and CHSI configurations. Provides technical support during the deployment of the CHSI product or the installation of additional CMTS's in the market.
Provides technical support during the deployment of the CDV product or the installation of additional soft switches in the market. Monitors and clears all hung COPS processing. Supports the implementation of new capacity associated with the facilities and trunking for PSTN interconnection. Acts as the SME in isolating problems between the switch service provider, transport distribution and subscriber telephony equipment. Provides subject matter expertise for all voice equipment, technical training and support to other operational groups. Ensures the voice network is optimally engineered. Analyzes and troubleshoots networks such as: Voice Infrastructure, CRAN/CMTS and transport. Designs, conducts and interprets database and switch translations.
Engineer 2 performing Systems Desk Specific function performs the following: Designs and creates tools that gather and integrate data from disparate systems (such as Comcast billing, ticketing, provisioning and network monitoring systems, among others). Designs, codes, tests, deploys and evaluates highly reliable programs in Perl, C, C++, C#. Designs, codes, tests, deploys and evaluates highly reliable web pages in PHP, ASP, JavaScript, Script etc. Collaborates with Engineering, Excellence in Operations (XOC), Advanced Technical Support and other internal departments to generate data for problem analysis and fix. Writes scripts in SQL, Perl, C++, JavaScript, ASP.Net.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.
Job Summary Responsible for delivering and supporting customer software defined networks on the Software Defined Networking platform. Plays an important role in the building and troubleshooting of customer network configurations and services. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.
Job Description


Implements Universal Customer Premise Equipment (uCPE) and associated services in the inventory management database and updates and/or modifies designs with Internet Protocol (IP) assignments and Common Language Location Identifier (CLLI) codes.
Provisions network service configuration in the Software Defined Networking (SDN) Service platform for services such as Firewall, NAT/PAT, QoS, DHCP, Traffic Steering, BGP, Static Routes, Wireless Backup, Hybrid WAN, High Availability, LAN and WAN interfaces, etc.
Completes Bill of Materials (BOM) for hardware required for each site provisioned, ensuring the configuration and hardware match to meet the customer’s requirements.
Working with Customer Project Managers (CPM), provides configurations and technical leadership as a primary technical resource on IP router network technologies, traffic flows, and overall end to end network communication during the Service Delivery process.
Tests and turns up new uCPE and Wireless Backup circuits in a production environment. May recommend new practices and procedures, as necessary.
Executes test plans and logs results. Gathers supporting documentation such as installation photos and speed tests.
Works with Field Technicians in all Regions, as well as related Engineering departments and centers, to maintain communications regarding work orders/projects. Instructs the field how to connect the uCPE and Underlay circuit(s).
Coordinates and resolves service issues with providers and vendors to ensure accurate and timely implementation and resolution of off-net Underlay circuit issues.
Coordinates efforts to resolve issues so all orders are completed in a timely fashion.
Develops and implements test and acceptance criteria for network elements.
Troubleshoots IP networking and security issues, providing resolutions according to established practices and procedures including executing packet captures, analyzing network performance data, reviewing security profiles, parsing log files, and understanding the customer’s desired outcome.
Interfaces with customers to help educate them on the use and functionality of their service.
Expertly troubleshoots IP and Network Security issues including routing, performance, connectivity, access, network address translation, access control lists/firewall rules, and network management protocols (DHCP, DNS, etc.).
Analyzes network performance metrics and identifies service affecting root causes to customer chronic and systemic issues. Collaborates with customer, Development and Strategic Engineering, and SDN Service platform vendor during in-depth troubleshooting.
Executes Change of Service requests through the SDN Service platform. Validates functionality after changes made to ensure customer satisfaction.
Escalates issues in a timely fashion. Provides all relevant information, accurately entering information into trouble ticket database.
Directs efforts so as to maintain service Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) within regional or contractual standards.
Performs deep dives and root cause analysis into customer issues looking for systemic problems.
Collaborates with Engineering and Vendor teams on resolution of systemic problems.
Coordinates and implements patches in the production environment to resolve systemic problems.
Provides feedback to and supports applications/features/products under development. Assists with the software update process for existing applications, and rollouts of software releases.
Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify tool and technical requirements to support Operations. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.
Works with Product Development team to determine if products, features, and applications fit specification and technical requirements.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including product and feature designs, evaluation test plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Understands Network Function Virtualization (VNF) concepts and strategies including Universal Customer Premise Equipment (uCPE).
Demonstrates expert level knowledge of Internet Protocol (IP) routing and switching fundamentals (See Preferred Requirements).
Works in a 24x7 Operations environment supporting live customers.
Supports both standard customers as well as large/complex customers with custom designs and configurations.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a Unified Communications Engineer on the UC team, you will have the opportunity to assist in crafting the future of conferencing technologies and collaboration tools. You will partner with end users and Divisions engineers to help move Comcast’s video and collaboration technologies in the right direction. As a result, you should be passionate about the conference room experience and have a strong desire to play a major role in evolving the technologies that support a future hybrid workforce.
Job Description
This exciting engineer position on the Unified Communication Team is a key resource providing operational support across all the technologies in the Unified Communications infrastructure. You will work directly with the Telephony, Video and Collaboration teams to lead quality of end-to-end experience for users in conference rooms and hybrid meetings/events who are using Microsoft Teams and other collaboration tools. Join and become part of the nationalization of AV Conferencing Standards and the implementation and support of Microsoft Teams Rooms. You will also partner with your peers in telephony operations to ensure the capabilities exist to support collaboration and conferencing needs.
About the Team
Unified Communications engineers collaborate with industry experts from subject areas including virtual meeting/event tools, audio and video technologies and AV Integrators providing installation & upgrade services. You work closely with Microsoft, Cisco and other leaders in the collaboration tools space. Experience partnering with other technology companies like Polycom, Logitech, and Crestron to support products deployed within the Comcast environment. You will work with Comcast AV and IT peers, as well as engineering teams from across the national footprint including the Divisions, Partner Teams, NBCU and SKY.

What are some interesting problems you’ll be working on?
Comcast seeks to be a leader in creating the future hybrid workplace experience. We are focused on standardizing and improving the conference rooms experience, implementing a hybrid events' solution, leading a flexible seating solution, and producing hybrid and on-site events. We are looking for individuals to help us implement technologies that build an outstanding collaboration experience for all users regardless of their location.

In your role, you will assist in the development and operations of Comcast collaboration tools and infrastructure. You will Identify issues and resolve root cause. Focused on ensuring the effective deployment of current and future solutions as well as assisting in creating the infrastructure necessary to monitor and support new collaboration needs. You will implement a next generation monitoring solution to enable proactive alerting on in-room and infrastructure issues. Evaluate new product releases for basic reliability and provide engineering guidance to frontline teams who are supporting the end users.

Where can you make an impact?
You will be making a significantly measurable contribution to creating the future hybrid workplace for Comcast. Your decisions will help craft the technology capabilities and direction for teamwork and conferencing. You will bring the expertise and background in this technical area to assist us in delivering on our dedication to build “the best hybrid workplace.”


Understand user needs and assist in evaluating future technologies to support the hybrid work experience.
Collect and organize technical data related to assigned projects. Presents data and findings for review at the next level of engineering management.
Develop, maintain, and update processes for existing applications and devices
Assists in the deployment of new product releases
Track and handle the tickets and rework associated with infrastructure and tools.
Work with Vendors and AV Integrators to provide T4 Services across the entire Comcast footprint
Read and analyzes technical references and sources to obtain knowledge of assigned Engineering Operations topics. Identifies common operational and technical problems with standard solutions. Escalates more complex issues to senior Operations Engineers.
Know the latest with technological developments within the industry. Monitor and evaluate competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Displays expertise and knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts and skills in the area of specified engineering specialty
Works towards industry standard certifications and education.

Here are some of the specific technologies we work with day to day:
Microsoft - Teams Devices & Direct Routing, 365 Suite, Azure, Exchange Online
Cisco - WebEx Telepresence
Comcast Digital Voice telecom carrier infrastructure
Support of Flex Seating Tools - IOFFICE
Support of Hybrid Event Tools - Teams Live, Airmeet


Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell, Javascript, Bash
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, C#, Go, Ruby
Knowledge of how to scale applications for variable loads
Adherence to modern IT security standards
Knowledge of web application development including dynamic HTML, CSS, and JS integration
Good communicator and able to clearly articulate sophisticated issues and technologies
Understanding of design philosophies and problem-solving skills
Takes ownership of problems and sees them through to resolution
Comfortable working in a fast-paced agile environment. Requirements change quickly and our team constantly adapts to moving targets.

Get results and growth!

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Comcast IPCDN team is a fast-growing, fast paced team of world-class experts who are continuously innovating IP Content Delivery. We are a team that grows with big challenges, superior results, high-quality products, well-documented software, and the agility to move quickly in all areas. As a QA Engineer on the CDN team, you will help build the infrastructure, develop and test software to support the systems that deliver IP content for a wide range of mobile and first-screen television devices. As part of the larger Comcast engineering teams, you will help shape the next generation of IP content delivery and transform the customer experience. Using the tenets of DevOps, you will have the opportunity to own the entire stack, from architecture to production. Who does the CDN QA engineer work with? Traffic Control is the Open Source CDN control plane for which we lead the development and testing, and this project represents our primary focus. Want to learn more? Visit https://trafficcontrol.apache.org/. There you will find the documentation, source code, and every open bug. We’re a small team, delivering state-of-the-art software solutions at the leading edge of CDN technology. What are some interesting problems you’ll be working on? We deliver petabytes of traffic and billions of transactions every day. Our software infrastructure is crucial in analyzing this data to visualize trends, and enable deep-diving into issues. Where can you make an impact? Thinking out of the box and considering the customer experience are key to our success. We never want to impact service unless it is in a positive manner. We need additional team members to follow their passion of coding and contribute to the delivery code at the heart of many organizations!
Job Description
The QA Engineer is responsible for the development and maintenance of automation software and tools that will improve testing processes and increase test coverage across the CDN control plane. This includes the modification of existing test frameworks and test suites as well as providing additional testing and debugging of defined CDN components. Engineer should be capable of working with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.


Build and maintain automated test scripts designed to perform positive, negative, regression and load testing of individual software components as well as test integration dependencies across the components of the CDN control plane.

Identify and analyze system and environment issues, determine root cause, propose and deliver maintainable solutions.

Research and evaluate 3rd-party solutions in the area of test automation and reporting.

Solve production issues and support the greater CDN platform as needed.

Develop a deep understanding of the interactions between all components of the CDN control plane to propose and develop high-value automated end-to-end/integration tests.

Engage application developers to define feature requirements and any requirements vital for test automation.

Perform code reviews for the team and provide constructive feedback in terms of standard methodologies and maintainability of proposed code changes.

Display knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.

Consistently exercise independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Regular, consistent and punctual attendance.

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Here are some of the specific technologies we use for Traffic Control:

Docker

Ansible

Bash

Go (Golang)

Linux (CentOS)

Git

Apache httpd

InfluxDB

OpenStack

Python

Jenkins


An open mind and a passion for coding excellence

BS in Computer Science and 2+ years equivalent experience

Experience in OO programming languages Java or C/C++. Experience with Golang helpful.

Knowledge of Object Design, Design patterns, and Algorithms

Experience developing software for Networking, Web services, DNS, HTTP, and TCP/IP

Good communicator; able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies understandably and engagingly

Great design and problem-solving skills, with a strong bias for architecting at scale

Strong solving and problem-solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership

Able to work in a fast-paced environment


The CDN team is a quasi-startup group within Comcast’s Technology and Product Division and is based in Denver’s LoDo district. Our technology is open-source based, and our products deliver video and other content over IP infrastructure to an array of connected devices in and out of the home.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.
Job Summary Responsible for being the escalation point of contact for all high level break/fix and maintenance issues or events for the OC. Provides subject matter expertise for CRAN, CMTS, transport, Video, CDV, HSI and works closely with the engineering teams. Performs a variety of highly complex analytical duties in the planning development, testing and evaluation of Comcast's network. Responds to escalations and resolves issues that arise from hardware and software failures. Manages network tuning, performance and designs strategies and makes recommends to improve network performance.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Performs a variety of highly complex analytical duties in the planning, development, testing and evaluation of Comcast's network, including CRAN, CMTS and the IP platform and Video platform. Works closely with engineering and national teams on network operations to ensure proper and efficient operations of the network.
Measures volume and performance of the network traffic; identifies utilization and performance issues; designs strategies and recommendations to improve network performance. Provides necessary support for additions and changes.
Devises and implements strategies for solving network issues or increasing network performance, including the development and production of network system documentation and instructional and procedural manuals for other employees to utilize in order to resolve problems or make network improvements. Supports all the OC tools and alarms, analyze systems needs and determines priority of devices attached to the network.
Ensures the availability of networking services; studies, evaluates, analyzes and monitors the network to determine problem areas and/or areas of concern. Monitors and isolates outages and impairments. Ensures that server databases and other related resources are properly maintained and devises strategies to improve performance of the network.
Provides subject matter expertise for all network equipment, technical training and support to other operational groups. Updates code and software to ensure proper system performance.
Engineer 2 performing Network Desk duties performs the following: Determines if the network, or a portion of the network, needs to be shut down to resolve complex issues. Provides technical support for the capacity and utilization reporting and tuning across the product lines. Tests, monitors and analyzes the network to isolate outages across all product lines. Performs port turn ups and downs on CRAN aligned to the agreed to demark matrix. Develops changes and improvements in the network including re-routing of traffic. Provisions DWDM and CWDM circuits.
Engineer 2 performing Video Desk duties performs the following: Participates in the review of video failures, as appropriate and provides feedback to prevent future occurrences within the established post mortem process. Accountable for video configuration audits and adherence to the golden configuration. Supports national desk for DSG and 2way conduit applications. Supports all channel migration from the headend to the CRAN. Supports all SD and HD channel launches. Uses all available tools to monitor and isolate IP video outages and impairments. Maintains all IP video delivery devices (i.e. RPD's, OM-1000's and NC-1500's). Performs MPEG troubleshooting through a variety of highly complex analytical duties in the testing and evaluation of Comcast's network. Provides operational support for the DAC and DNCS in conjunction with engineering and AVS. Directs Headend Technician(s) in troubleshooting network issues for video, ADS and Switched Digital video.
Devises modulation changes to the CHSI QAMs. Acts as the SME in isolating problems between the CMTS, transport distribution and subscriber Modem equipment. Ensures the CHSI network is optimally engineered. Analyzes and troubleshoots networks such as: CHSI Infrastructure, CRAN/CMTS and transport. Designs, conducts and interprets database and CHSI configurations. Provides technical support during the deployment of the CHSI product or the installation of additional CMTS's in the market.
Provides technical support during the deployment of the CDV product or the installation of additional soft switches in the market. Monitors and clears all hung COPS processing. Supports the implementation of new capacity associated with the facilities and trunking for PSTN interconnection. Acts as the SME in isolating problems between the switch service provider, transport distribution and subscriber telephony equipment. Provides subject matter expertise for all voice equipment, technical training and support to other operational groups. Ensures the voice network is optimally engineered. Analyzes and troubleshoots networks such as: Voice Infrastructure, CRAN/CMTS and transport. Designs, conducts and interprets database and switch translations.
Engineer 2 performing Systems Desk Specific function performs the following: Designs and creates tools that gather and integrate data from disparate systems (such as Comcast billing, ticketing, provisioning and network monitoring systems, among others). Designs, codes, tests, deploys and evaluates highly reliable programs in Perl, C, C++, C#. Designs, codes, tests, deploys and evaluates highly reliable web pages in PHP, ASP, JavaScript, Script etc. Collaborates with Engineering, Excellence in Operations (XOC), Advanced Technical Support and other internal departments to generate data for problem analysis and fix. Writes scripts in SQL, Perl, C++, JavaScript, ASP.Net.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Sr. Windows Engineer is responsible for planning and designing complex Windows infrastructure. The engineer analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new solutions and the documentation of all development activities. They will train non-technical personnel and assist with supervising performance metrics and integrating knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a catalyst in a sophisticated and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and share expertise. About DevX Platforms The goal in DevX Platforms is to provide teams with tools that help deliver and manage their systems. This entails creating and maintaining infrastructure services and platforms that app teams can use as services. Who does the engineer work with? An engineer on the DevX Platforms team can expect to work with cross-functional teams within Comcast, including: Collaborating with DevOps engineers to understand their use cases so that we can build tools and processes to simplify their workflow Subject matter experts to identify best practices for implementing our products and services Organization architects to share solution designs and gather feedback on higher-level goals Cybersecurity to ensure our solutions are adhering to security standards and enabling other teams to meet security standards What are some interesting problems you’ll be working on? Creating solutions to enable secure, hardened, and patchable OS images running on multiple platforms, including physical hardware, private clouds, and public clouds Enabling other teams to deploy and configure their VM-based workloads Opportunity to use new technologies and platforms
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements.
Conducts analysis to resolve integration needs.
Design and implement processes that support Windows infrastructure, applications under development, and current applications.
Develop software update processes and security solutions.
Train junior Engineers on internally developed processes and applications.
Leads all aspects of the researching, writing, and editing of documentation and technical requirements, including evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals, and formal recommendations and reports.
Keeps current with technological developments within the industry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products.
Reviews literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Provides technical leadership and mentorship with regards to practices, procedures, and techniques.
Serves as a guide and mentor for junior-level Engineers.
Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team delivers solutions on time, to specification and within budget.
Expertise in knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts and skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.
Expertise in process design and redesign skills.
Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal audiences.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Bachelor's Degree and 7-10 years of proven experience
Proficiency with Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, PowerShell, Active Directory/Group Policy, HashiCorp Packer, Terraform, and Ansible
Strong proficiency with software analysis, testing, and reporting
Self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills
Proven track record of leading junior staff members and project teams

Title: Engineer 6, Tier 2 Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), you'll help build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining software and systems to develop creative engineering solutions to operations problems. Much of our support and software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, eliminating/mitigating production outages, and reducing work through automation. You'll join a team of innovative complex problem solvers with a diverse set of perspectives who bring thought-leadership, solution design and take measured risks. In this environment, you'll take the lead on relevant projects, supported by an organization that provides the team work, collaboration, and mentorship you need to learn and grow. As an SRE, you'll be focused on improving and enhancing reliability and sustainability of production applications and systems.
Job Description
The Site Reliability Engineer will be responsible for keeping all user-facing services and production systems running efficiently. Across multiple practices within Deloitte, as an SRE engineer, you will work with multiple teams across our organization to introduce SRE principles, establish reliability goals, and develop tooling for operational observability.

In this role, you will be responsible for planning, developing and integrating application, server, and network observability systems and analytics tools. You will also integrate with several BSS/OSS systems such as network systems, CRM, ticketing and notification platforms. This role serves both the internal IT organization and customer facing Operations organization.

Leads technical bridges and provides troubleshooting direction within 70+ enterprise applications. Including Einstein365, Xfinity.com, and ComcastNow.

You will have opportunity to lead the handling of system outages and repairing system operation issues within these applications.

Interact with our 3rd party vendors and coordinating integrations.

Acts as an advocate for Engineering Operations procedures, policies and processes. Ensures projects are fully coordinated into the operations environment including lifecycle problem management from front line CARE through Engineering.

Builds data and metric systems to supervise operational workflows; maintains records of results and feedback. Analyzes data and metrics, identifies problem areas and provides practical insight to management.

Provides guidance to Engineering and vendors on defects and required improvements. Attains all relevant industry standard technical certifications.

Performs complex and routine maintenance tests for designated areas of engineering. Identifies, isolates and escalates issues to appropriate personnel. Ensures that all maintenance is accurately validated to minimize subscriber impact to (ideally) zero.

Contributes to design considerations for new products or architectural changes to existing products. Assists with or leads efforts to build new application infrastructure, coordinating efforts across teams.

Analyses problems in design, configuration, data flow and data state within a highly sophisticated multi-product provisioning system.

Serves as team lead on multiple projects, often spanning different engineering disciplines within the organization.

Leads the integration of projects into operations including instrumentation, automation, standardization and methods/procedures.

Does not have any direct supervisory responsibilities. May direct workflow and act as a technical lead.

Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Strong technical knowledge of the Enterprise Platform in the IT space or extensive experience with the BSS or OSS platform.

Having experience with web technologies such as Node JS and Angular would be a PLUS.

Job Summary The Site Reliability Operations Engineer is encouraged to provide Operational, Incident, Problem and Change management support for a set of applications within the Enterprise Application group. The applications supported include but are not limited to OSS/BSS, Middleware, Customer CARE Applications/Tools, Tech applications/Tools, Internal Enterprise human resource, legal and Data Management Systems. This includes business functions such as billing, provisioning, activation, authentication, Telco/Cable operations, Serviceablity, and Cloud based applications. The individual will work closely with peers within the Reliability Engineering group, as well as develop excellent working collaboration with organizations across the company. The ideal candidate will possess a consistent track record of technical leadership, creative thinking, problem solving, mentoring, and continuous learning. They are expected to be a subject matter expert in multiple areas and help establish a team of subject matter experts.
Job Description


Act as a thought-leader, technical authority and first point of reference for leading practices in reliability engineering.

Develops strong technical knowledge of the applications and services

Effective Incident Manager during outages who have the respect of management and Engineer fix agents.

Partners with Engineering and Deployment peers to drive meticulous root cause investigations and action items which improve system availability and resiliency

Collaborates with development teams to understand application changes and identify potential issues that may arise, build implementation and back-out plans, and oversee the implementation during the scheduled maintenance window.

Ability to work in a fast-paced 24x7 technical operations environment.

Displays expertise in knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, and skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.

Acts as a mentor to junior engineers within the organization.

Regular and consistent attendance

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

10+ years of technical experience supporting Operations, Incident Management, Problem Management, Service Availability Management, and/or Change Management

Proven record of working in a collaborative environment to lead large scale data implementation projects

Familiarity with Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles

Outstanding written and oral communication skills, with ability to articulate sophisticated emergent situations clearly to all levels of the organization.

Experience in Telco/Cable industry preferred

Experience preferred with

BSS/OSS platforms. Knowledge of Amdocs/CSG Billing system preferred, Experience in running Billing Operations

Middleware & Business integeration.(Mulesoft, WebLogic, NgNIX)

Micro Service Architecture, Web Services (SOAP XML)

Software development in Python, Angular, Java.

Experience in IP Networking preferred.

Experience in working with databases

Solid understanding of Mobile Virtual Network Operations functions is a plus

Highly collaborative with a strong work ethic.

Embraces challenges, displays strong creative flexibility.

Familiarity with ITIL and/or eTOM frameworks

Job Summary Responsible for developing and deploying machine learning algorithms. The Comcast Applied AI & Discovery organization is looking for a new team member to join us on our mission to create rich metadata from video to create novel experiences for our customers.
Job Description

Implements, refines and validates machine learning algorithms for products and applications.
Takes action on existing specifications of designs and develops data pipelines consisting of data ingest, data validation, data cleaning and data monitoring.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer/Researcher
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Comcast Applied AI & Discovery organization is seeking a team member to research and implement new detection capabilities for use within our Media Analysis Framework (MAF). You will rely on your experience in natural language processing and machine learning to extract insightful metadata from the video. You will work closely with other researchers and engineers to create algorithms for video analysis at scale. Additionally, you’ll ensure that your components are well-tested, production-ready, and performant at scale. A master’s or PhD degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, mathematics, or a related technical discipline is desired. Experience with natural language processing in multiple languages, including machine translation, is also desired. Responsible for identifying complex problems and developing and deploying novel prototypes and algorithms to solve them. Improves accuracy and functionality of algorithms and understands the overall implications of the entire machine learning frameworks. Translates application requirements into problem statements. Analyzes and evaluates solutions both internally generated as well as third party supplied. Develops novel ways to solve problems and discover new products. Provide guidance and leadership to more junior researchers. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Guides the successful completion of programs that identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention. Determines the technical objectives of an assignment. Leads the design of prototypes, partnering with the product team and other stakeholders through development. Conducts studies to support product or application development.
Designs and implements end-to-end solutions using optimization and other advanced computer science technologies and owns live deployments. Aggregates huge amounts of data and information from large numbers of sources to discover patterns and features necessary to automate analytical models.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including evaluation plans, confluence pages, white papers, presentations, test results, technical manuals, formal recommendations and reports. Contributes to the company by creating patents, Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) and other intellectual property.
Presents papers and/or attends conferences, as well as displaying leadership in these areas.
Tests and evaluates solutions presented to the Company by various internal and external partners and vendors. Completes case studies, testing and reporting.
Collaborates with teams outside of immediate work group. Represents the work team in providing solutions to technical issues associated with assigned projects.
Mentor a diverse team of junior engineers in machine learning techniques, tools and concepts. Provides guidance and leadership to more junior engineers.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary
Job Description
Provide technical leadership to teams within the CPE department, responsible for designing, developing, and enhancing software applications and systems for Customer Premises Equipment (CPE), including home security cameras, video settop boxes, and broadband routers; lead the design, development, and maintenance of the Reference Design Kit (RDK) software stack and implement it on CPE within the Xfinity Home platform; use C, C++ and Linux operating system to develop software in an Agile development environment; design, implement, and support components including Live Streaming using WebRTC, CVR using Kinesis Video, AI using MediaPipe and TensorFlow, and BLE; use the following network technologies and protocols: HTTP, SNMP, TFTP, HMS, and TCP/IP; work with Bluetooth and Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technologies; lead technical discussions on RDK-C projects; distribute tasks based on sprints and conduct daily status calls with the team; track technical activities and tasks, guiding the team to project completion; ensure software modules are compatible with RDK software components; participate in architectural discussions with architects; develop requirements with the product team; work with cross-functional teams, the QA team, Feature Test team, DevOps team, and Application team on a daily basis to resolve technical and design issues and bugs; and guide and mentor junior-level engineers. Position is eligible for 60% remote work.

Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field, and five (5) years of experience developing software using C, C++, and Linux operating system in an Agile development environment; using WebRTC, MediaPipe, and TensorFlow; using the following network technologies and protocols: HTTP, SNMP, TFTP, HMS, and TCP/IP; working with Bluetooth and Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technologies; and mentoring engineers.

Job Summary Comcast is in the process of constructing our data driven customer journey and messaging platform in partnership with the Comcast Xfinity Assistant utility for use by Comcast customers across multiple channels. These Xfinity Assistant Journeys (XAJ) are an orchestrated customer experience leveraging business process management (BPMN), data intelligence, AI based recommendations, and email and SMS communications to create a series of connected interactions. These journey interaction types range from predictive troubleshooting, proactive notifications for outages, and technician appointments and visits. Within the context of the XAJ program, this role will be responsible for development and testing of the services and communications that comprise the Xfinity Assistant Journey platform. Edits new and existing applications. Implements, testing, and debugging defined software components. Documents all development activity. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.
Job Description
Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.
Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Assists with the software update process for existing applications and roll-outs of software releases.
Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.

Displays in-depth knowledge of and ability to apply, process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal audiences.
Displays knowledge of and ability to apply, project management skills.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
