Title: Eng 2, Ops Engineering
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
Xfinity.com Experience Platform team is seeking a Software Engineer to join our development team. This team of highly passionate engineers is responsible for working on the Xfinity.com Experience Platform team building scalable REST services that power Xfinity.com functionality. In this role, you will collaborate internally, and with other teams, developers, architects, and product owners to develop platforms for Public Cloud. You are able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong teammate, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer requirements. The ideal candidate will have experience building and deploying Web apps and REST APIs on AWS / Azure cloud.

Core Responsibilities
Collaborates with project partners to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to settle integration needs.
Crafts new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Assists with the software update process for existing applications and roll-outs of software releases.
Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Monitors and evaluates driven applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and mentorship with regards to practices, procedures and techniques. Serves as a guide and mentor for junior-level Software Development Engineers.
Works with Quality Assurance team to resolve if applications fit specification and technical requirements.
Displays in-depth knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.
Displays in-depth knowledge of and ability to apply, process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal audiences, and project management skills.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Ability to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as vital.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Strong programming skills for platform API integration - language JavaScript.
Experience or knowledge of Node.js.
Ability to articulate high caliber solutions for application programming architecture.
Technology leadership experience.
Comprehension of Sitecore or a content management platform.
Ability to triage and mitigate defects and incidents.

Job Summary Comcast Technology and Product Experience (TPX) is seeking an Android developer to join the Connected Living Home Client Application Engineering team. This group is responsible for customer-facing mobile, web, and voice application development for Comcast’s Home Security, Home Network Management and Internet of Things product offerings. This includes the native Android & iOS Xfinity application, which manages our cloud enabled gateway for millions of homes and is expanding internationally. Learn more about us at https://www.xfinity.com/apps. Check out the Xfinity Android app!
Job Description
In this role, you will be an Android Engineer on the Mobile Core squad where you will collaborate with stakeholders to improve developer productivity, write hands on code for mobile components and libraries, lead and drive conversations on technical architecture, and influence the Xfinity Android app architecture. You must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will have experience building native Android applications that rely on multiple web services and operate at a scale of millions of users.
REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications

3+ years of professional software engineering experience

2+ years professional experience in developing native client applications in Kotlin/Android
Experience

Experience buildingorconsuming RESTful web services

Fundamental understanding of the HTTP protocol and caching strategies

Experience withmultiple specific Android technologies/libraries; Kotlin, Coroutines, Dagger, MVVM, Jetpack Compose

Experience managing software projects with source control systemslikeGitHub

BONUSSKILLS (Nice to have but not required)

Experience maintaining Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelinesorworkflows

HOW WE WORK

We have a flexible remote-friendly culture. We follow a hybrid work model and you can choose to work from home or in the Philadelphia HQ

We follow thesquadsand guildsengineering modelfor developing mobile apps at scale. Our native Android & iOS developerswork closely with each otheracross multiple squads,following agreed upon design patterns,reviewing pull requests,and learning and growing together

Platform leads influence change through mobile tech design reviews and Android & iOS guild meetings

We have a strong onboarding process with 30-, 60- and 90-day goals, with onboarding buddies assigned to you so that you can succeed as an Android developer.

Job Summary Comcast Technology and Product Experience (TPX) is seeking a senior iOS Developer to join the Connected Living Camera Client Engineering team. This group is responsible for customer-facing mobile application development for Comcast’s Home Security Camera product offerings. This includes the native iOS and Android Xfinity application, which primarily handles our cloud enabled Internet Gateway for millions of homes but is expanding to become Comcast’s primary mobile app with new features such as bill pay. Learn more about us at https://www.xfinity.com/apps. Note: We are currently working in a flexible hybrid model with the team working in the office Tuesday through Thursday.
Job Description

In this role, you will be an iOS developer on the Camera Client Squad where you will collaborate with stakeholders to improve the customer experience with our Xfinity cameras. You’ll work to improve developer productivity, code UI features and libraries, participate in and help drive conversations on technical architecture, and influence the Xfinity iOS app architecture for millions of customers. You’ll also get to work with other passionate iOS developers as a peer, mentor, and mentee in our continuous learning culture. You are able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong teammate, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will have experience building native iOS applications with video players.

Requirements
Qualifications

7+ years of professional software engineering experience

4+ years professional experience in developing Swift native client applications (iOS, macOS)
Experience

Experience building or consuming RESTful web services

Familiarity with MVVM and other architectural patterns

Fundamental understanding of iOS video players

Fundamental understanding of the iOS application privacy and permissions settings and their APIs

Eagerness for learning and adapting to new technologies - We use Combine and SwiftUI, but we do not require prior experience with these new technologies for this role. Some experience is a plus.

Experience with multiple specific iOS technologies/libraries; Accessibility, Localization, and Internationalization

Serving as a coach and mentor for early-career iOS developers

Experience leading software projects with source control systems like GitHub

Experience maintaining Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines or workflows

Technical leadership throughout the design, development, testing and deployment processes of core iOS libraries and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques

Eagerness for learning and adapting to new technologies

A strong sense of ownership and responsibility for code quality that follows best practices
How we work

We follow the squads and guilds engineering model for developing mobile apps at scale. Our native Android & iOS developers work closely with each other across multiple squads, following agreed upon design patterns, reviewing pull requests, and learning and growing together

Our engineers influence change through mobile tech design reviews and Android & iOS guild meetings

Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.

Comcast and Charter Communications will form a 50/50 joint venture that will bring our world-class Flex streaming platform, 4K streaming devices, voice remote and XClass TVs nationwide. You will want to join our innovative team, because together we will develop and offer consumers a next-generation streaming platform, with a world-class user experience and navigation and all the top apps, bringing more choice to the streaming marketplace. Comcast also will contribute XUMO to the joint venture, our free ad-supported service that currently delivers more than 200 unique streaming channels and features hundreds of free content choices.

Title: Eng 2, Ops Engineering
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Are you passionate about digital media, entertainment, cloud platforms and networking security? Do you like big challenges and working within a highly motivated team environment? As a security engineer at Comcast, you will drive the design and implementation of our hybrid cloud and on-premise micro-segmentation program, which includes network security orchestration and automation tools. The team you’ll be joining is a fast-moving group of world-class experts who are innovating in delivering software-defined network provisioning and security. We provide our customers with the network connectivity and security they need to be successful in their hybrid cloud infrastructure journey. The team’s engineers are closely aligned with cloud, security and network architects to ensure our products and services consistently meet customer demands. We are a team that thrives on big challenges, results, quality and agility. You’ll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast to help roll out our micro-segmentation program. You’ll drive technical decision making and implementation in how the platform integrates with cloud and network device APIs to provide appropriate connectivity, apply appropriate network segmentation policy and ensure that developer and security consumers of the platform have appropriate self-service management and security review capabilities.
Job Description
Responsible for acting as an individual contributor within the Platform Security team focused on implementing Comcast's micro-segmentation strategy. You
will help drive continued development and roll out of the NETWORK/APPLICATION SEGMENTATION AND AUTOMATION program, including design / architecture/ configuration specification, prototype development, training/education content, and tool design/implementation.

Be a part of the Platform Security team focused on implementing Comcast's micro-segmentation strategy. Youwill help drive continued development and roll out of our NETWORK/APPLICATION SEGMENTATION AND AUTOMATION program, including design / architecture/ configuration specification, prototype development, training/education content, and tool design/implementation.
Work with architects, engineers and development teams to design and implement automated segmentation controls
Assist teams with decisions on how to properly structure applications to fit into Comcast’s segmentation model

Additional
Implement technical vision and strategies of Comcast’s micro-segmentation program
Partner with Ops and Product stakeholders to develop applications and tools in a business / customer experience driven framework.
Assist in design work for micro-segmentation automation and APIs
Create prototypes in a lean / agile manner in order to influence product direction.
Document development efforts through system design flows, data models, etc
Act as engineering lead for sub projects of the overall program
Develop technical implementation and infrastructure standards within the team through design and architecture reviews
Provide technical expertise and troubleshooting skills for large scale enterprise systems and software
Develop, configure, and deploy prototype systems used to test new features for the Comcast microsegementation program
Develop training material and design patterns to educate users on the Comcast micro-segmentation program
Assist other teams in migrating existing architectures into Comcast’s micro-segementation platform.


BS in Computer Science or similar degree with equivalent industry experience
Experience designing, building, deploying and operating software products that present practical and understandable solutions to complex problems
Experience with Python or Go.
Git, JIRA, etc.
Experience with Terraform and Ansible
Experience with rapid prototyping.
Experience with Agile and/or Kanban.
Experience with SaaS and cloud-enabled environments a plus.
Understanding of application architecture, IP networking, network security patterns and traffic scaling
Broad technical knowledge of all common security domains
At least 8 years experience in SecDevOps, software development , or a Security architecture/engineering role
System orchestration and control infrastructure elements, API integration frameworks, AWS, Azure, Openstack, Kubernetes, and proprietary virtualization operating environments
Working and practical knowledge of TCP/IP and UDP/IP networking
Superb written and oral communication skills

Preferred Qualifications
Strong experience securing large scale application platforms with background in network segmentation
Hands on experience designing, building, and deploying prototype environments on Linux for rapid experimentation and configuration development
Experience with physical and virtual network security and segmentation technologies, including F5 firewalls, AWS security groups, OpenStack, Azure, Google Cloud, Kubernetes
Script development experience using languages like Ruby, Golang or Python to interface with RESTful services and data interchange using XML, JSON, Protobuf or MessagePack
Experience with large-scale distributed application architectures and application communication patterns
Experiencing debugging and documenting communication patterns of existing applications.
Understanding of Service-Oriented Architectures (SOA and REST), Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS)
Deep understanding of HTTP, TCP, DNS, UDP, IPv4/IPv6 networking and protocols
Experience with Agile, including Scrum and/or Kanban
Understanding of how DevOps and DevSecOps influences software development and operations practices and delivery techniques
Ability and desire to mentor peers both within and outside your team

Job_Description:

Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. Job Summary Come to work on Comcast’s best product, our Customer Experience. We are using Big Data and Machine Learning technologies to create proactive problem resolution for our customers. This is only possible by managing petabytes of system data and creating a world class platform to create predictions for the tens of millions of customers that we serve. The Culture of Comcast’s Technology and Product organization: • We have a bias for action and outcomes • We are agile and seek continuous improvement • We take our work seriously but don’t take ourselves too seriously • We are passionate about winning together This position designs and develops updated infrastructure in support of one or more business processes. Helps to ensure a balance between tactical and strategic technology solutions. Considers business problems “end-to-end”, including people, process, and technology, both within and outside the enterprise, as part of any design solution. Identifies and drives issues through closure. This role brings to bear significant cloud experience in the private and public cloud space as well as big data and software engineering. This role will be key in the re-platforming of the CX Personalization program in support of wholesale requirements. This person will engage as part of software delivery teams and contribute to several strategic efforts that drive personalized customer experiences across product usage, support interactions and customer journeys. This supports the building of real-time big data platforms, machine learning algorithms and data services that enable proactive responses for customers at every critical touch point.
Job Description
Our Product and Engineering team practices iterative development and continuous deployment. We work in small teams and keep our projects short and focused. Engineers rotate between projects and areas of the product to learn and take on new challenges. As a member of our Engineering team at MLX,you'll be given substantial feature ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute product ideas as well as code. You will be responsible for collaborating within the engineering team and with stakeholders. You can expect to:
Build and maintain features in our platform ranging from distributed data processing systems to in-browser data visualization tools.
Work with teammates to identify challenging product and engineering problems and then come up with elegant solutions.
5+ years of experience working in a software development environment, including full-time, hands-on application software development experience
Ability to work as part of a team of developers and with the testing groups while also successfully managing individual tasks and projects with minimal guidance
Keen attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills that facilitate teamwork and interaction with colleagues and internal clients
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


We believe in using the right tool for the job and are comfortable with a polyglot codebase. That said, we use the following in various capacities and expect that you are an expert with some, but probably not all of these:
Object Oriented Language like Java, C++ or C#
Spark, Flink or NiFi
OracleDB, Hadoop, Redis, Cassandra, Druid Neo4J, Neptune
Cloud technology experience with AWS or similar
5+ years of experience working in a software development environment, including full-time, hands-on application software development experience
Ability to work as part of a team of developers and with the testing groups while also successfully managing individual tasks and projects with minimal guidance
Keen attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills that facilitate teamwork and interaction with colleagues and internal clients

Job_Description:

Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers. Comcast’s Smart Network Platform (SNP) Organization falls within CONNECT and aims to revolutionize network engineering at Comcast by providing a network data collection, alarming, and automation platform to drive consistency and standardization; eliminate manual changes; increase network visibility; and ultimately minimize customer impacting incidents.
Job Description
We are considering candidates both commutable to our Philly campus and fully virtual home based.

We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer who can work independently, lead projects, recommend, design, and build solutions based on experience, knowledge, and new technologies.
Role and Responsibilities
As a Principal Engineer in the SNP Organization, you will divide your time across architectural work and software development work. Architectural work will include gathering requirements from Product and collaborating with other software engineers across teams, to inform architectural guidance and recommendations for the 10 agile development teams in SNP. Software development work will include embedding in software development teams to design and lead feature development, including writing code, mentoring developers, performing design and code reviews, and promoting architectural recommendations and best practices.

In this role, you will be hands on at least 50% of the time.
Skills and Experience

Ten or more years of experience designing and building complex solutions in the Java ecosystem

Hands-on design, development, and delivery of microservices

Proficiency with object-oriented design and programming

Experience designing and implementing REST API-based services

Proficiency with concurrency and multi-threading

Experience implementing services using the Spring Framework, Spring Boot, Sprint Cloud

Experience using and integrating with AWS products (S3, RDS, CloudWatch, Dynamo, SQS, EC2, ECS, Fargate, Lambda, Kinesis, CloudFormation, etc.)

Experience deploying applications with appropriate security, observability and alerting designed-in

Experience with Behavior Driven Development, Test Driven Development, Test First Development

Experience with CI/CD and automated deployment

Basic computer networking knowledge (firewalls, routing, CIDR, subnets)

Experience with AWS networking (VPC, subnets, security groups)

Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases

Experience evaluating third party open source and commercial products as potential component parts of larger solutions

Experience evaluating public and private cloud services as potential component parts of larger solutions

Experience with one or more other languages/technologies such as Golang, Python, NodeJS, is a plus

Job_Description:

Job Summary Comcast Technology and Product Experience (TPX) is seeking a Principal Software Engineer for iOS to join the Connected Living Client Application Engineering team. This group is responsible for customer-facing mobile, web, and voice application development for Comcast’s Home Security, Home Network Management and Internet of Things product offerings. This includes the native iOS and Android Xfinity application, which manages our cloud enabled gateway for millions of homes and is expanding internationally. Learn more about us at https://www.xfinity.com/apps.
Job Description
In this role, you will be an iOS platform technical lead on the Core Connectivity squad where you will collaborate with stakeholders (Product, UX, and microservices teams) to write hands on code for mobile components and libraries, lead and drive conversations on technical architecture, and influence the Xfinity iOS app architecture. Core Connectivity features are at the center of our Xfinity app, with the goal of providing tools for our customer to understand their network, solve issues, and enable additional services like parental controls or Advanced Security. You are able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong teammate, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will have experience building native iOS applications that rely on multiple web services and operate at a scale of millions of users.
Requirements

Qualifications

8+ years of professional software engineering experience

5+ years professional experience in developing Swift native client applications (iOS, macOS)

3+ years as a technical lead, with at least 3 other developers (technical, not people management), for a large-scale consumer facing application with at least 100K app downloads on the App Store.

Experience in SwiftUI.
Experience

Experience building or consuming RESTful web services

Fundamental understanding of the HTTP protocol and caching strategies

Experience driving adoption of software engineering best practices within your team

Experience working with an app that integrates with several internal mobile libraries

Experience with multiple specific iOS technologies/libraries; Accessibility, Localization, and Internationalization

Experience leading software projects with source control systems like GitHub

Experience maintaining Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines or workflows
Leadership

Ability to effectively communicate technical challenges and solutions

Ability to solve ambiguous or undefined problems

Technical leadership throughout the design, development, testing and deployment processes of core iOS libraries and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques

Presentation and advocating for architectural, design, and technical choices to internal and external audiences

Serving as a coach and mentor for junior- and mid-level Software Development Engineers
Collaboration

Eagerness for learning and adapting to new technologies

A strong sense of ownership and responsibility for code quality that follows standard methodologies

Collaboration with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements, conducting analysis to settle integration needs

BONUS SKILLS (Nice to have but not required)

Experience in designing and interacting with REST/ RPC based API micro services

Experience with reactive frameworks and architectures, like Combine or Flux

Experience developing shareable components using SwiftUI

DevOps Native App build experience; CocoaPods, Jenkins, Fastlane, XCUITests

Experience working with OpenAPI Specification

Experience working with Internet-of-things frameworks or platforms; SmartThings, Nest, AWS IOT
How we work

We have a flexible remote-friendly culture. We follow a hybrid work model, and you can choose to work from home or in the Philadelphia HQ

We follow the squads and guilds engineering model for developing mobile apps at scale. Our native Android & iOS developers work closely with each other across multiple squads, following agreed upon design patterns, reviewing pull requests, and learning and growing together

Platform leads influence change through mobile tech design reviews and Android & iOS guild meetings

We have a strong onboarding process with 30-, 60- and 90-day goals so that you can succeed as an iOS technical leader

Comcast Engineers are enthusiastic about teamwork, growing their skills, and creating excellent experiences for customers. We are fortunate to do what we love, every day! Join us!
We’re interested in attracting a diverse set of candidates for this position. If you’re not sure that you qualify, please apply!

Title: Eng 2, Ops Engineering
Job_Description:
Effectv, the advertising sales division of Comcast Cable, helps local, regional and national advertisers use the best of digital with the power of TV to grow their business. It provides multi-screen marketing solutions to make advertising campaigns more effective and easier to execute. Headquartered in New York with offices throughout the country, Effectv has a presence in 66 markets with nearly 35 million owned and represented subscribers. We’re dedicated to helping our clients meet their business goals by connecting them with their customers through multiscreen television advertising. Working with companies from local startups to nationwide corporations, we provide support to help each business reach its target customers. By applying data to television advertising in new ways, we’re able to bring our clients the best of digital media, coupled with the power of TV. To learn more, check out www.effectv.com.
Job Summary Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Oversees the documentation of all development activity. Trains non-technical personnel. Assists with tracking performance metrics. Provides guidance and support to other Engineers. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.
Job Description
Full stack developer, C#, .Net, .Net Core, IIS, ASP.net, MVC, JavaScript, Ajax, HTML/CSS, Jquery, Web Services, XML, SQL Server, Visual Studio, AWS (Athena, S3, Glue, SNS, SQS, IAM), Azure, Github, MS SQL
SSIS, WCF, TDD, asp.net core, Azure Devops

Core Responsibilities
Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.
Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Develops software update processes for existing applications. Assists in the roll-out of software releases.
Trains junior Software Development Engineers on internally developed software applications.
Oversees the researching, writing and editing of documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Keeps current with technological developments within the industry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Assists with technical leadership throughout the design process and assists in guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques. Serves as a guide mentor for Software Development Engineers.
Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team delivers software on time, to specification and within budget.
Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements. Tests and evaluates systems, subsystems and components.
Acts as a technical contact and liaison for outside vendors and/or customers.
Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal and external audiences.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Job Description

Guides the successful completion of programs that identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention. Determines the technical objectives of an assignment. Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary
Job Description
Provide technical leadership to teams within the CPE department, responsible for designing, developing, and enhancing software applications and systems for Customer Premises Equipment (CPE), including home security cameras, video settop boxes, and broadband routers; lead the design, development, and maintenance of the Reference Design Kit (RDK) software stack and implement it on CPE within the Xfinity Home platform; use C, C++ and Linux operating system to develop software in an Agile development environment; design, implement, and support components including Live Streaming using WebRTC, CVR using Kinesis Video, AI using MediaPipe and TensorFlow, and BLE; use the following network technologies and protocols: HTTP, SNMP, TFTP, HMS, and TCP/IP; work with Bluetooth and Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technologies; lead technical discussions on RDK-C projects; distribute tasks based on sprints and conduct daily status calls with the team; track technical activities and tasks, guiding the team to project completion; ensure software modules are compatible with RDK software components; participate in architectural discussions with architects; develop requirements with the product team; work with cross-functional teams, the QA team, Feature Test team, DevOps team, and Application team on a daily basis to resolve technical and design issues and bugs; and guide and mentor junior-level engineers. Position is eligible for 60% remote work.

Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field, and five (5) years of experience developing software using C, C++, and Linux operating system in an Agile development environment; using WebRTC, MediaPipe, and TensorFlow; using the following network technologies and protocols: HTTP, SNMP, TFTP, HMS, and TCP/IP; working with Bluetooth and Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technologies; and mentoring engineers.

Job_Description:

Job Summary As a Senior Cybersecurity Engineer for Comcast Business, you will join a dedicated, professional team responsible for the security of Comcast Business' products & services. You will work in a supercharged, fast-moving environment, with some of the industry’s smartest applications and platform teams who are responsible for creating products that deliver the services to millions of Comcast Business customers. You will lead and collaborate with various cross-functional technology, product, experience, and security teams. Exercise engineering skills and methodologies. Apply long-term objectives and plans related to the Company's technical vision to daily activity. Apply innovative solutions for securing developmental problems that are competitive with industry and company standards. Integrate knowledge of business and functional priorities.
Job Description
You Will
Serve as a key liaison between Comcast Cybersecurity and Comcast Business product and application development teams.
Define and drive creative security solutions in line with Comcast Cybersecurity Policies & Standards
Apply the Comcast Secure Development Lifecycle (SDL) principles as you evaluate the variety, velocity, volume & veracity of the cyber-threat landscape.
Collaborate with various cross-functional technology, product, experience, and security teams helping to instill best practices
Work with the vulnerability remediation team to manage the burndown of security vulnerabilities and remediate high-risk security issues.
Partner with engineering teams to lead the definition of security architectures and solutions while balancing security risk against product and application development priorities

You Have
Team First Attitude
8 - 12+ years related experience
Passion for cybersecurity, an entrepreneurial spirit, persistence, and resourcefulness
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, preferably in cybersecurity, computer science, management information systems or equivalent training
Knowledge of complex network operating environments, including remotely hosted or cloud-based service offerings
Knowledge of cloud security in public cloud (AWS, Azure)
Comfortable with interfacing with other internal or external organizations regarding incident response situations.
Solid understanding of common security vulnerabilities and vulnerability management practices
Ability to rapidly grasp new technologies and abstractions and apply them in a meaningful way
Ability to communicate complex security concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to engage development teams to develop remediation plans that align with development schedules.

Great To Have
GIAC, CASP+, CCSP, CISSP or similar certification(s) preferred
Familiarity with data security protection, security and privacy by design concepts
Exposure to cloud-native technologies
Familiarity with development and programming including Agile development
Understanding of hardware, embedded software, cloud, or application architectures to communicate technology requirements to related teams
Experience with Vulnerability Scanning software (Qualys, DAST, Prisma Cloud, etc)
We Are
A team of consummate cybersecurity professionals that constantly challenge each other to be the very best
Collaborators & servant leaders bridging the gaps among Cybersecurity, DevOps, Product Development & Customer Experience.
Cover broad cybersecurity domains from privacy, identity, asset management, threat data protection, and vulnerability management, to governance risk & compliance.

Job Description
The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers.

About the Team
Comcast’s Smart Network Platform (SNP) Organization aims to revolutionize network engineering at Comcast by providing a network data collection, alarming, and automation platform to drive consistency and standardization; eliminate manual changes; increase network visibility; and ultimately minimize customer impacting incidents.
Role and Responsibilities
As a software engineer in the SNP Organization, you will collaborate with other software engineers, write production and test code, participate in design and code reviews, and follow recommendations and best practices.

In SNP, we value face-to-face collaboration and so you will be working on site at the Comcast Technology Center in Philadelphia one to two days a week when the office is open.
Skills and Experience

Five or more years of experience designing and building complex solutions in the Java ecosystem

Experience with multi-threading and Java 8 concurrency

Experience Java 8 Collections, Streams

Hands-on design, development, delivery, and deployment of highly scalable microservices in cloud environments

Experience designing RESTful APIs

Proficiency with object-oriented design and programming

Experience implementing services using the Spring Framework, Spring Boot, Sprint Cloud

Basic computer networking knowledge (firewalls, routing, CIDR, subnets)

Experience with AWS networking (VPC, subnets, security groups, Cloud Formation, TGW, DXGW)

Experience using and integrating with AWS products

Experience deploying applications with appropriate security, observability and alerting designed-in

Experience with Behavior Driven Development, Test Driven Development, Test First Development and related tools and libraries (Junit, Mockito, Cucumber)

Experience with CI/CD

Experience with infrastructure and deployment automation (Jenkins, Jenkins Pipeline, Terraform, Ansible)

Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases

Experience with Azure Virtual Networking (VNet) is a plus

Core Responsibilities
Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.
Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Assists with the software update process for existing applications and roll-outs of software releases.
Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques.
Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements.
Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary

Job Summary Freewheel Media, Inc., a leading fast growing Video Adserving company is seeking a Lead SRE, Operations to build and support the latest Server side systems. This candidate would be responsible for planning, leading and collaborating with various teams in designing and presenting the architecture related to Data platform, Linear ads platform and transcoding module. Work on internal incubated projects and prove ideas by quickly showing the usable code;

Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers.


The Comcast DPA team is looking for a DevOps engineer who loves working with new technology and has a passion for working on highly performing distributed applications that process billions of transactions per day. Our platform utilizes Kafka and Cassandra for data streaming and storage, ElasticSearch and Kibana for LaaS, and Telegraf, Prometheus, and Grafana for MaaS. Our software is written mostly in Java, with some C/C++ and Scala as well. The platform stores real time device provisioning data used in advanced advertising, fraud mitigation, and auto authentication.

As a DevOps engineer, you will be responsible for the design, development, testing, installation, monitoring and troubleshooting of software running on our Big Data platforms and utilizing data streaming technologies.

A successful candidate will have an established background in large scale service-oriented applications running on hundreds of servers in multiple data centers. You should have strong technical ability, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.


Manage the deployment and configuration of hundreds of servers
Install and deploy software
Design, develop and test software applications.
Set up monitoring systems for all new hardware and software
Perform and automate, and monitor daily database backups and maintenance
Automate and maintain disaster recovery procedures, user assistance and troubleshooting
Automate repetitive tasks.
Configure and manage the automated deployment process
Work with the Quality Assurance team to determine if applications meet technical requirements
Diagnose performance issues both in the lab and in production, and propose and implement improvements
Analyze and resolve complex technical problems, particularly pertaining to Big Data products and applications
Plan database and server level capacity according to statistics and user requests
Provide 24x7 on-call production support


5 years of experience in Linux administration, memory, file systems, networking and debugging.
3+ years of experience with Cassandra.
3+ years of programming skills in Shell Scripting, Python and Perl.
3+ years of experience with Kafka (administration, configuration, troubleshooting).
Deep understanding of certificate management, TLS troubleshooting, single sign-on, encryption ciphers and key management.
3+ years of hands-on experience of using standard CICD/devops tools such as GitHub, Ansible, and build tools like Concourse, Jenkins.
Excellent in troubleshooting Java application and network related issues.
Excellent communication skills, both verbally and written.
Experience in writing technical system admin guides, installation guides and troubleshooting guides.
Knowledge of cloud computing technologies (AWS, Azure, CloudFoundry, etc.).
BS in computer science, computer engineering.


Working knowledge of network principles such as DNS, DHCP and TFTP is desired.
Experience with LaaS Stack (Elastic Search, logstash, Kibana) for monitoring.
Experience with Prometheus and Grafana collection and monitoring.
Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker.
Experience with NoSQL (Mongo, Redis, etc.).

Job Summary The Comcast Applied AI & Discovery organization is seeking a team member to research and implement new detection capabilities for use within our Media Analysis Framework (MAF). You will rely on your experience in natural language processing and machine learning to extract insightful metadata from the video. You will work closely with other researchers and engineers to create algorithms for video analysis at scale. Additionally, you’ll ensure that your components are well-tested, production-ready, and performant at scale. A master’s or PhD degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, mathematics, or a related technical discipline is desired. Experience with natural language processing in multiple languages, including machine translation, is also desired. Responsible for identifying complex problems and developing and deploying novel prototypes and algorithms to solve them. Improves accuracy and functionality of algorithms and understands the overall implications of the entire machine learning frameworks. Translates application requirements into problem statements. Analyzes and evaluates solutions both internally generated as well as third party supplied. Develops novel ways to solve problems and discover new products. Provide guidance and leadership to more junior researchers. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Guides the successful completion of programs that identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention. Determines the technical objectives of an assignment. Leads the design of prototypes, partnering with the product team and other stakeholders through development. Conducts studies to support product or application development.
Designs and implements end-to-end solutions using optimization and other advanced computer science technologies and owns live deployments. Aggregates huge amounts of data and information from large numbers of sources to discover patterns and features necessary to automate analytical models.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including evaluation plans, confluence pages, white papers, presentations, test results, technical manuals, formal recommendations and reports. Contributes to the company by creating patents, Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) and other intellectual property.
Presents papers and/or attends conferences, as well as displaying leadership in these areas.
Tests and evaluates solutions presented to the Company by various internal and external partners and vendors. Completes case studies, testing and reporting.
Collaborates with teams outside of immediate work group. Represents the work team in providing solutions to technical issues associated with assigned projects.
Mentor a diverse team of junior engineers in machine learning techniques, tools and concepts. Provides guidance and leadership to more junior engineers.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Comcast IPCDN team is a fast-growing, fast paced team of world-class experts who are continuously innovating IP Content Delivery. We are a team that grows with big challenges, superior results, high-quality products, well-documented software, and the agility to move quickly in all areas. As a QA Engineer on the CDN team, you will help build the infrastructure, develop and test software to support the systems that deliver IP content for a wide range of mobile and first-screen television devices. As part of the larger Comcast engineering teams, you will help shape the next generation of IP content delivery and transform the customer experience. Using the tenets of DevOps, you will have the opportunity to own the entire stack, from architecture to production. Who does the CDN QA engineer work with? Traffic Control is the Open Source CDN control plane for which we lead the development and testing, and this project represents our primary focus. Want to learn more? Visit https://trafficcontrol.apache.org/. There you will find the documentation, source code, and every open bug. We’re a small team, delivering state-of-the-art software solutions at the leading edge of CDN technology. What are some interesting problems you’ll be working on? We deliver petabytes of traffic and billions of transactions every day. Our software infrastructure is crucial in analyzing this data to visualize trends, and enable deep-diving into issues. Where can you make an impact? Thinking out of the box and considering the customer experience are key to our success. We never want to impact service unless it is in a positive manner. We need additional team members to follow their passion of coding and contribute to the delivery code at the heart of many organizations!
Job Description
The QA Engineer is responsible for the development and maintenance of automation software and tools that will improve testing processes and increase test coverage across the CDN control plane. This includes the modification of existing test frameworks and test suites as well as providing additional testing and debugging of defined CDN components. Engineer should be capable of working with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.


Build and maintain automated test scripts designed to perform positive, negative, regression and load testing of individual software components as well as test integration dependencies across the components of the CDN control plane.

Identify and analyze system and environment issues, determine root cause, propose and deliver maintainable solutions.

Research and evaluate 3rd-party solutions in the area of test automation and reporting.

Solve production issues and support the greater CDN platform as needed.

Develop a deep understanding of the interactions between all components of the CDN control plane to propose and develop high-value automated end-to-end/integration tests.

Engage application developers to define feature requirements and any requirements vital for test automation.

Perform code reviews for the team and provide constructive feedback in terms of standard methodologies and maintainability of proposed code changes.

Display knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.

Consistently exercise independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Regular, consistent and punctual attendance.

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Here are some of the specific technologies we use for Traffic Control:

Docker

Ansible

Bash

Go (Golang)

Linux (CentOS)

Git

Apache httpd

InfluxDB

OpenStack

Python

Jenkins


An open mind and a passion for coding excellence

BS in Computer Science and 2+ years equivalent experience

Experience in OO programming languages Java or C/C++. Experience with Golang helpful.

Knowledge of Object Design, Design patterns, and Algorithms

Experience developing software for Networking, Web services, DNS, HTTP, and TCP/IP

Good communicator; able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies understandably and engagingly

Great design and problem-solving skills, with a strong bias for architecting at scale

Strong solving and problem-solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership

Able to work in a fast-paced environment


The CDN team is a quasi-startup group within Comcast’s Technology and Product Division and is based in Denver’s LoDo district. Our technology is open-source based, and our products deliver video and other content over IP infrastructure to an array of connected devices in and out of the home.

The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Job Summary Responsible for crafting, building, and implementing network and computer systems across the enterprise. The roles of this position include planning, developing, installing, configuring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing all local and wide area network connections, corporate servers, associated software, active directory environment, and communication links. This position fixes network and systems performance issues, analyzes network traffic, and provides capacity planning solutions. Diagnoses, resolves, and documents hardware and software network problems in a timely and accurate fashion and provides training and support where required in accordance with the mission, core values, and purposes of the company. Provides domain expertise. Resolves break/fix scenarios, engaging broader teams as vital and partners/leads vendors and regions to deliver continuous improvement. Chips in to command-and-control related activities passionate about restoration of sophisticated outages, communication across Comcast and rapid restoration. Works and directly leads external vendors, third parties and associated agencies when vital to address issues across the infrastructure. May participate on 24/7 on-call rotation. Works with moderate mentorship in own area of knowledge.
Job Description Responsibilities
Perform systems administration, maintenance and support on infrastructure including servers, workstations, printers, network devices, and mobile devices
Support day-to-day network operations, focusing on uptime, availability, and support.
Configures and maintains routers, switches, and hubs for network systems (including wireless)
Support production systems with primary or secondary responsibilities.
Responsible for planning, crafting, upgrading and extending support of the network
Plans and recommends network hardware, systems management software and architecture.
Design and Configuration of Enterprise Firewalls and Security Appliances
Build and maintain documentation for network structure, issues and support.
Maintain hardware and software configuration images.
Follow established security policies and procedures.
Preventative maintenance for all network systems and services.
Develops solutions for moderate to difficult systems engineering problems. Given enough time, can tackle most problems without sufficient documentation readily available. Makes corrections and adds to documentation as vital to maintain proper procedures and engineering documents.
Performs backups, recoveries and restores. Understands storage allocation impact on system performance. Conducts comprehensive performance and capacity monitoring, tuning and analysis.
Installs and configures application software on servers following prescribed instructions. Uses knowledge of networking and TCP/IP filtering to facilitate firewall and ACL requests. Correlates application-layer metrics and network device metrics, such as throughput, response time, congestion, dropped messages, queue depth measurement and lost data.
Actively participates in problem resolution, using knowledge about systems which are under their direct control. Uses a methodical tackle approach.
Uses time management and project management skills to resolve issues in a timely and organized manner, effectively communicating vital information.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as vital.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications
Good communication and social skills
College degree in Information Technology or related field preferred
CCNA active certification, CCNP preferred or equivalent experience with Cisco networking equipment.
Systems administration skills in Active Directory, VMware and.
Ability to work a flexible schedule with some evening/weekends work
Minimum of 3 years network administration or comparable experience
Experience working daily in a team environment
Good organization and problem-solving skills
Good project management skills
Sense of urgency, ability to trouble shoot sophisticated problems is required
Access to transportation for on-call response to facilities in Philadelphia, West Chester and Southern New Jersey.


While performing the essential functions of this job, the employee is continuously asked to multi-task under time limits. The employee will be in a bi-weekly on-call rotation with their turn in the rotation usually being two months apart. During on-call hours employee is responsible to respond to any business critical network or system related issues remotely or in person. The job has the potential for a non-standard schedule during maintenance periods or high transparency events. Position requires constant attention to precise details and accuracy of specified standards including: following simple to sophisticated (more than 3 steps) instructions, and concentration which frequently extends beyond 30 minutes at a time.


While performing the essential functions of the job, the employee constantly operates a computer and other office devices such telephones, copy machines, fax machines, etc; occasionally moves about inside the office to access storage areas, cabinets and office machinery; constantly moves about the arena to service clients; constantly communicates via telephone, email and in-person with others to exchange accurate information; occasionally lifts/carries computer equipment.


The essential functions of this position are performed indoors. The noise level in the work environment can range from minimal to loud during events depending on the employee’s location, and is minimal during non-event times


Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience Technologies (CXT), led by Rick Rioboli, EVP and Chief Information Officer, and are responsible for the technology, systems and tools that support the customer lifecycle (sales, activation, billing, support, etc.), as well as employee-facing teams such as human resources, finance, and workplace information technology. These tools and systems are foundational to our ability to meet and exceed customer expectations and support an excellent employee experience.
Our vision is to be an authority in products, services and solutions which power and enable fabulous, connected customer experiences for Comcast and other organizations through a steadfast focus on transparency and teamwork.

Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers.


As a Comcast Network Engineer, you will join an experienced team of engineers responsible for the infrastructure and core routing design of Converged Regional Area Network (CRAN). Additional duties will include performance engineering, real time analysis and optimization of the existing CRAN. Each Comcast CRAN combines the following services – high speed data, video, voice, and business services - onto a single converged IP infrastructure. Our network is comprised of approximately 15,000 routers, four vendors, and dozens of platforms supporting Residential and Business Services customers spanning 28 regional networks across the nation.


Service provider experience
Very Solid understanding of IP routing/switching (ISIS, OSPF, BGP, MPLS)
Solid scripting skills required, in any of the following languages: Python, Perl, Unix, PHP, and MySQL
Proficient in the understanding and practical application of programming the network versus configuring networks
Solid grasp of IPv4, IPv6, Multicast and QOS
Very organized individual with the ability to handle multiple projects, lead and/or participate on multiple project teams
Proven business skills to interact with internal business units and external vendors
Additional experience in server-based technology, such as Microsoft and Unix is a plus
Prior network engineering and support experience. Generally, requires 5+ years of related experience.
BS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or other technology related field


Working with Open Source. Both as a user and community contributor.
Virtualization
Software Defined Networking, network automation, data-plane programming.
Quagga, Bird, FD.io VPP, FBOSS, Wedge, Cisco Lindt, Kafka.
Network telemetry, key-value & JSON document stores, time-series databases.
Distributed systems


Engineering support CRAN services – high speed data, video, voice, and business services products.
Contribute efforts to automate internal processes and tools to improve overall consistency in routine engineering task execution.
Drive towards an environment and architecture where programming networks can replace a model of traditional network configuration.
Support and/or improve standard methodologies and procedures for network installation, maintenance, and operation.
Implement Network Engineering plan of record including, business requirements, network strategy, project priority and financial budget plan.
Model network capacity for failure scenarios to proactively predict routing and topology changes.
Monitor network capacity, plan and implement market augments as needed.
Exercise Comcast standard processes during site design, network configuration, and network activation to ensure efficient use of funds and time.
Participate and/or lead assigned interdepartmental technical projects.
Communicate applicable design guidelines and provide guidance to regional markets to ensure compliance to network design standards.
Develops practices and procedures for network installation, maintenance, and operation.
Develops and implements test and acceptance criteria for network elements.
Schedules equipment activations, customer-affecting network maintenance develops documents of customer networks for network users. Meets with potential customers, designs solutions, implements solutions that are adaptable to customer need changes.
Exercises judgment during incident management, site design, network configuration and network activation to ensure efficient use of funds and time.
Designs network site planning for multiple regional network sites.
Develops and maintains network element documentation and inventory. Maintains appropriate inventory or network spare equipment for rapid restoration.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


This team interacts with corporate, local, and divisional management to provide support on an ongoing basis.

Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.
Job Summary The Sr. Tier II NOC Engineer is responsible for configuring and troubleshooting Masergy solutions to resolve the customers’ technical concerns. The person will act as liaison between the customer and other internal teams. The person must have the ability to work in complex networking environment and ensure a smooth operation of the network in order to provide a maximum performance and availability to the customers. A quick thinker who is able to multitask several issues at once and a fast learner. The person must be flexible to work shift hours and be available for one weekend day (Sat or Sun).
Job Description
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
Troubleshoot escalated issues with external customers and network/telecom providers
Work with service providers and vendors to drive issues to resolution
Carry out maintenance activities according to engineering MOP’s
Configure routers, firewalls and NIDs using standard and non-standard templates
Perform circuit, router and firewall activations for new and existing customers
Perform maintenance and grooms of T1, E1, DS3, OC3, OC12 and high capacity Ethernet circuits
Investigate and complete a Reason For Outage (RFO) reports on all network outages
Mentor and help train Tier I NOC Analysts
Accept call overflows for frontline NOC support team during major outages
Learn and understand Masergy’s products and services, navigation tools of all applications needed in the processes and observing SLAs and performance measurements assigned.
Ensure configurations meet customer expectations as well as industry and product standards.
Additional duties as assigned.

EDUCATION
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related field.

EXPERIENCE
Minimum seven (7) years’ experience working in LAN/WAN implementation or support role (Implementation/troubleshooting responsibilities include routers, switches, firewalls and NIDs), preferably from a service provider company.
Very strong hands-on experience with Alcatel (Nokia) ESP, Cisco routers and switches, Fortinet firewalls, Overture and Adva NIDs
Extensive experience in configuring, implementing, and maintaining a high availability network environment.
CCNP/CCSP level equivalent experience is a must.

CERTIFICATES / LICENSES / REGISTRATIONS
Certification on CISCO CCNP and above, LINUX, MCITP, Python, Fortinet NSE 4 and above or similar is preferred.

Education
Bachelor's Degree
While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.
Relevant Work Experience
5-7 Years
