Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a member of the Technical Integration team, you are instrumental in on-boarding partners into the X1 family of products such as IP Video, broadband, telephony, and smart home that are operated and managed as a service. You will be provided with an opportunity to work with cutting edge video and network technology while interfacing with top tier 1 cable providers in North America and abroad. In this role you will be working on the number one program at our partners with the highest level of executive visibility. Are you passionate about digital media, entertainment, and software services? Do you like big challenges and working within a highly motivated team environment? We are looking for an outstanding Integration Engineer within the CTS organization who will work closely with TPX system architecture and CTS program delivery teams that are responsible for delivering new products and functionality to partner cable providers. Integration initiatives range from on-boarding of new features on existing products to the onboarding of large-scale strategic services to Comcast and our partners. We are a team that thrives on big challenges, results, quality, and agility. Who does the Integration Engineer work with? The Technical Integration System Engineer will work closely with TPX Architecture team, the CTS Program Delivery teams and the CTS Operational Readiness Team. The Technical Integration System Engineer will interface with the TPX Architecture team to understand and document the technical dependencies needed to on-board a partner to new services. The Technical Integration System Engineer will work with CTS program delivery teams to help interface and guide partners on what needs to be done to rollout a feature or product to their customers. The Technical Integration System Engineer will work with the CTS Operational Readiness teams to ensure Comcast support tools are available to partners to facilitate the proper operation of the service. This position is integral to the CTS organization, providing customer facing architectures, troubleshooting at early stages of integration and guiding partners on best practices. What are some interesting things you will doing? In this role, you will be responsible for defining customer facing solution architecture, customer facing documentation including designs, partner FAQs, integration best practices that you will then use to guide partners. In this role, you will be troubleshooting complex technical problems at early integration stages and working with Engineering teams and partners to identify root cause. In this role, you will work to deliver proof of concepts that can then be extended to partners as new service offerings. JOB SUMMARY Provide world class system integration support of X1 Services to partner cable providers in the North America and abroad. Follow all established procedures, protocols and safety guide lines, ask questions and expand your knowledge of projects and technology. Be a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment and as a cross-functional technical liaison.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Define end to end solution architectures
Define partner facing technical documentation to guide partners with the integration of their back-office systems with the X1 services.
Identify and document integration best practices that are the result of lessons learned from previous engagements.
Manage repository of partner FAQs in a way that can be generalized and distributed internally and across partners.
Identifies and clearly communicates technical integration requirements from partner through proper channels.
Ensures that technical issues which arise during the integration of partner systems with the X1 services are addressed in a timely manner and that a path to normal service operations happens as quickly as possible.
Works with internal Comcast and external partner resources to triage issues across the syndication product portfolio during the on-boarding phase of a product and/or feature.
Internally supports bug triage process to ensure defects are routed to the correct teams. Works with appropriate resources to validate fixes.
From time-to-time supports pre-sales conversations.
Works with CTS architecture and engineering groups to provide proof-of-concept for new services.
Recommends opportunities for process and technical improvements.
Supports delivery and operations teams in reviewing core performance metrics for partners vs Comcast.
Reports on the progress of all technical projects towards the company's engineering goals and strategies.
Tracks and reports status to project managers.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Flexible to work off hours for occasional travel and troubleshooting as necessary.


10+ years of system design and architecture with understanding of distributed systems.
MS Computer Science or related field with equivalent industry experience.
Strong experience with UNIX/LINUX is required.
Strong experience with IP delivery systems is required.
Strong experience with AWS Cloud services is a plus.
Experienced with Video and broadband technologies is a plus.
Experienced in supporting business objectives in a partnered/outsourced model.
Possesses the ability to rapidly grasp new technologies and abstractions and apply them in a meaningful way.
Excellent communicator, able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies understandably and engagingly.
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced agile environment.
Ability to adjust to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited information.
Highly motivated and able to work independently and in a group.
Able to take on problems with a minimum set of clearly defined requirements and articulate alternative solutions and approaches to solve the problem
Ability to travel within North America required.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

This is a highly dynamic environment with the primary business partners being Cable & Corp Finance, FP&A as well as Accounting groups. Experience with SAML/SiteMinder/Kerberos/Azure AD & other SSO procedures is preferred.
Ability to effectively plan, handle, deliver multiple tasks and adjust priorities.

At Comcast, we are creating incredible technology and entertainment products, connecting millions of people to the moments and experiences that matter most. And with that comes tremendous responsibility when it comes to Cybersecurity. After all, we operate one of the world’s largest, most sophisticated networks, connecting 100s of millions of devices, millions of customers and 100s of thousands of employees and partners. As a result, cybersecurity at Comcast isn’t just web scale… it’s the web and we build security tooling and visibility for our developers and products to make security clear and easy from start to finish in everything we do.

Required - experience automating development process with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Concourse, etc )

Required - experience with modern development tools and processes: Git, JIRA, Kanban, etc.

Required - experience performing code reviews as part of development workflow

Required - experience performing test driven development

Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Comcast’s Xfinity Video Platform group is looking for a passionate Software Development Engineer in Test to help build automated functional and efficient performance tests for our APIs that drive the Video entertainment applications in Comcast. This role will primarily be responsible for building the functional automation test adhering to the quality standards set forth by the wider organization and closely collaborating with the Product and Development teams in Philadelphia/Sunnyvale/London offices. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in helping validate API services that power the X1 video experience on various platforms such as Sky Glass, X1 Set top box, iOS, Android, Web, Roku and Smart TV for millions of customers and performance test them.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Write automated test code that allows for repeatable, reliable testing solutions to test restful services using API automation testing tools such as Karate, REST-Assured etc. and maintaining automation codebase in a version control system (GIT, SVN).
Work with the Development and Product management teams to understand new requirements and write functional/sanity/smoke tests
Collaborate with the QA team to translate regression test cases into automation tests
Write mock scripts to test error handling and resiliency of the APIs
Performance test of restful micro-services and provide SLAs on it
Automate and execute performance test scripts to measure speed and reliability of the APIs using performance test tools such as k6, j-meter etc.
Develop and setup Sanity, Daily run and Regression tests using Concourse CI/CD tool


Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.


BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject
5-7 years of professional experience in Software QA and API Automation
3-4 years of experience using industry standard API automation tools such as Behave, REST-Assured, Soap, Postman, Karate, etc.,
Proficiency in modern programming languages such as Java or Python
Proven experience testing and automating REST API services
2+ years of experience working with Continuous Integration (CI) and build tools such as Maven, or Concourse
Experience in XML, Web Services, and testing the performance of RESTful API
Strong experience with GIT Version Control System
Performance testing experience using LoadRunner, JMeter, k6 etc.
A strong sense of ownership and responsibility for code quality that follows best practices
Ability to effectively collaborate with other software engineers within the team
Adaptable, committed to deadlines and willingness to work in a fast-paced environment
Must have excellent interpersonal and communications skills

The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Job Summary Responsible for leading a team which provides insight into our customers, business operations and products based upon the collection, analysis and modelling of company data. May manage a team including exempt and non-exempt employees. Provides subject matter guidance to employees as required. Develops processes and procedures to drive department efficiencies. Assists in development and meeting of departmental budget.
Job Description
The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers.

Who does the Manager, Data Science work with?
The Data Engineering and Science team as part of our CONNECTivity team is a diverse collection of professionals who work with a variety of organizational roles ranging from software engineering teams whose software integrates with analytics services, network architects and engineers, to service delivery engineers who provide support for our product, testers, operational stakeholders with all manner of information needs, and executives who rely on data for data based decision making.

We're looking for someone to be a hands-on technical manager in building models and developing insights in addition to mentoring and guiding junior team members.

What are some interesting problems you’ll be working on?
Develop models capable of processing millions of events per second and multi-billions of events per day, providing both a real time and historical view into the operation of our products and services. Work on high performance real time data stores and a massive historical data sets using best-of-breed and industry leading technology. Work closely with various engineering teams to solve key optimization, insight and access network data challenges.

Where can you make an impact?
The Comcast CONNECTivity Data Engineering and Science team is acquiring, studying, simulating, and modeling to enable data as a key driver and core functional component toward better understanding, predicting, and dynamically optimizing the access network to improve overall user experience. Success in this role is best enabled by a broad mix of skills and interests ranging from traditional distributed systems software engineering prowess to the multidisciplinary field of data science.


Strong analytical skills sets with ability to wrangle big data and perform analysis and draw meaningful insights
Proficient in at least one programming language (Python, R, Pyspark) and working experience using AWS tool stack
Ability to engage with Customers and translate into data science requirements and stakeholder management
Working experience in building models and applying machine learning techniques
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance
Statistical analysis, machine learning, software development, code fluency (SQL, Spark, Python, R)
Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field
5-7+ years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models

Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a Senior Principal Software Architect working on the Delivery Engineering team part of the DevX organization, you will be enabling Comcast developers in faster delivery of reliable, performant, and scalable software products. You will be a technical leader on the team, having a large amount of input on technical design decisions and serving as a liaison to our collaborators, primarily other development teams. On our team, leadership is earned and not appointed; your communication and teamwork skills are just as important—if not more important—than your technical skills.
Job Description About the team
You will be joining Delivery Engineering teams that build and operate highly scalable delivery platforms to help 1000+ development teams deliver their software better, cheaper and faster.
We are forward-thinking DevOps teams that value minimalist processes and full end-to-end ownership of our platform from design, development, testing, deployment, support, monitoring and maintenance.
Beyond building and operating the platform, we are stewards of Delivery practices for a large Comcast technology organization, helping thousands of engineers deliver their software better, cheaper and faster. We create dedicated focus on delivery enablement work.
We are looking to expand our capabilities in the Continuous Delivery part of CI/CD: if you are passionate about infrastructure deployment, sophisticated deployment techniques and love leveling up others in these capabilities, you would be an excellent fit on this team.
What you’ll do
proposing changes and then leading implementation of technical improvements and new delivery capabilities
Leading a CI/CD Experience team that creates paved road features and experiences for developers, making it faster, cheaper or better for them to deliver their software
Working with collaborators to understand their roadmaps and identify critical technical capabilities that need development
Writing technical designs and documentation at varying levels of granularity
building proof-of-concepts and conducting exploratory experiments
Writing and reviewing tested, production-quality code when needed
Serving as an ambassador of CI/CD technologies and platform engineering to the broader technical community, both inside and outside Comcast
What you’ll bring
10+ years of relevant work experience
Relevant Computer Science coursework or bootcamp experience/equivalent
Proficiency in automated testing and Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) practices
Deep knowledge of deployment and debugging in Linux container environments
Excellent software development skills, in a diverse set of programming styles (either procedural, object-oriented, functional)
Hands-on experience developing distributed systems and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability
Experience with Agile development methodologies and practices
Experience with platform engineering a plus
facility with command-line utilities; familiarity with system administration tools and concepts a plus
Experience with Go, Ansible, Terraform, and AWS a plus
Ability to fix sophisticated distributed systems to identify and resolve issues
Understanding of security standard methodologies
Experience with open source contributions a plus
Exciting challenges you’ll be involved in where you can make an impact
Directly impacting developer experience for thousands of Comcast developers
Mentoring exciting engineers both on your team and across Comcast
Architecting and being responsible for the implementation of new delivery capabilities
Helping Comcast deliver value to production faster and more optimally

We’re interested in attracting a diverse set of candidates for this position. If you’re not sure if you qualify, please err on the side of applying. Our Values
We value usable and working solutions now over a detailed solution later
We value using good enough open source software over magnificent commercial software
We value diversity of opinion over group consensus
We value being able to pursue a plan together over everyone agreeing that the plan is the best one
We value context and responsibility over management visibility and direction
We start from the assumption that someone, somewhere has already resolved a solution to a problem; we value using their results over rediscovering them ourselves
We value actively and humbly seeking and appreciating honest feedback over preserving our egos
We value making decisions with research and reason over tradition or fear; we are fans of the scientific method
We value appreciative asynchronous communication and deep work over meeting-driven work
How we support you in building your software engineering craft
We actively participate in week-long 3-times-a-year LabWeek – a Hackathon where we test out innovative ways to push our platforms and products into the future.
We take the time to learn and guide each other through multiple internal technology conferences throughout the year.
We actively participate in dedicated technology, leadership and culture discussion forums, book clubs and internal podcasts.
We take the time to have fun and establish team camaraderie and psychological safety.
We support career exploration through project opportunities, rotations and gigs.

Job Summary As Senior Manager in Digital Commerce Experience (under Sales Technology Org), you will be responsible for building and maintaining user experiences on our e-Commerce site Xfinity.com. You will be working closely with business analysts, content and product partners to define and a deliver features and functionality with quality and speed providing our customers with a best-in-class shopping experience. You’ll be helping engineers develop their careers, matching people and projects based on current skills, development, personalities, and work styles.
Job Description
Core Values
We believe we can deliver excellent service and products without taking ourselves too seriously. It’s okay to find joy and humor in our work.
We value getting a usable and working solution in front of customers quickly to get feedback, so we can iterate and refine over holding out for a perfect solution later.
We value building simple solutions, embracing the basics and not over-engineering it.
We value a growth mindset and happily teach anyone what we’ve learned.
We value leadership through service; we rise and fall as a team.
We value actively and humbly seeking honest feedback.
We value an open and transparent channel of communication with all members of the team, regardless of their title and expertise.

Core Responsibilities
Hire, mentor, develop, & grow a well-balanced and diverse engineering team.
Collect and integrate feedback from each member of your team while cultivating the psychological safety for members of the team. Set clear expectations and provide thoughtful, meaningful, and impactful feedback to members of your team.
Cultivate excellence in the reliability, scalability, stability, security, and craft of the software your team builds.
Partner with product management, UX designers, content editors, engineering, finance, and security leads to develop and deliver the roadmap.
Assist the team in designing architecture and processes that deliver value, quality, and stability.
Build a minimal set of processes needed to ensure the team works effectively.
Participate in joint design and architecture sessions.
Guide the team through security, design, code reviews and code quality.

Preferred qualifications
10+ years of relevant work experience, including extensive programming experience and experience managing engineering teams.
Experience leading teams in customer-centric and agile organizations with empathy and compassion.
A track record of building stable and scalable software while delivering features on a fast paced schedule.
Experience building, delivering, and operating services web experiences
Experience on a DevOps team working with CI/CD, Azure and AWS Application monitoring, issue triaging will be very helpful in this role.
BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience developing web applications using ReactJS, Node.js, Sitecore or other JavaScript frameworks.

Job Summary As a successful ServiceNow developer in Comcast Reliability Engineering, you will do much more than build applications, infrastructure, tools, and people. You will be part of the team that is building new business applications, process automation and business insight capabilities that enable world-class operational excellence for our technology & business organizations. In addition, you will be crucial in supporting the end-to-end customer experience that will drive continuous improvements across the organization.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Collaborates with project partners to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to settle integration needs.
Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development, and customizes current applications. Assists with the software update process for existing applications and roll-outs of software releases.
Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals, and formal recommendations and reports.
Monitors and evaluates driven applications and products. Reviews literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and mentorship with regard to practices, procedures, and techniques. Serves as a guide and mentor for junior-level Software Development Engineers.
Works with the Quality Assurance team to resolve if applications fit specifications and technical requirements.
Displays in-depth knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills, and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.
Displays in-depth knowledge of and ability to apply, project management, process design, and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design, and technical choices to internal audiences.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
4-7+ years overall work experience
3+ years experience with ServiceNow, developing core ITSM modules including Incident, Problem, Change, CMDB, Asset, Notify, Asset Management, Service Portal, Agent Workspace
ServiceNow Admin Certification
Expertise with workflows, flow designer, catalog items, Business Rules, Inbound email actions, script includes
Experience with web service integrations (REST, SOAP), Mid Server configuration
Strong verbal and written communication skills and demonstrated technical leadership

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with large scale, enterprise ITSM implementations
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Experience with portal development, including creation of custom web components in Service Portal [CSS, Angular JS, node.JS, Bootstrap]
Experience designing, developing, implementing business applications in ITIL, CMDB, Service Catalog, SDLC, Change Management, and Incident Management
ITIL v3 certification
Ability to understand product/customer needs and convert into experiences within Agent Workspace, leveraging the full suite of workspace capabilities
ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist, ServiceNow Certified Application Developer

Job Summary Do you have a real passion for building tools and products to improve the Customer Experience (CX), User Experience (UX), and Quality? Are you an “outside of the box thinker”? If yes, then join our team of highly skilled software development engineers who collaborate closely to address sophisticated problems which may impact our customers and develop user focused tools and applications to make it easier to identify, triage and resolve issues which impact our customers’ experience. If you share in our passion for partnership, our vision to redefine CX, and our goal to own the future in user-centric design, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.


Kaleidoscope Engineering team builds products and services for our enterprise AI Ops platform by providing big data ingest and processing with an integration into our ITSM platform.. The team is highly motivated and creative with sophisticated strengths that enhance the team’s performance demonstrating technologies in a hybrid cloud environment and NextGen technologies.
The Sr. Engineer role in Kaleidoscope is an authority with vision to innovate and build solutions to support central initiatives. They will work directly with Users, Architects, and global teams to ensure quality work you're doing. They will also be a key player in enhancing and developing new features. As the lead engineer in Kaleidoscope team, they will help mentor, guide engineers, and provide overall technical guidance to the team. Instrumental in partnering with other Comcast teams to support new product features and enhancements and define improvements for overall business processes.


Design and build scalable, high-volume processing application and Java web applications focused on Platform as a Service.
Optimize the performance of the system for higher performance.
Participate in design and code reviews.
Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new applications.
Experience in Agile framework and its various implementations like Scrum, Kanban etc.
Develop systems that are highly scalable, but easy to maintain
Collaborate with colleagues on design and architecture
Build high-throughput and low latency micro services.
Assists with tracking performance metrics.
Provide solutions to sophisticated problems and formally operationalize a product to resolve the problem.
Proven understanding of DevOps and has the tact to build tools for supporting application in production.
Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities.
Acts as a motivator in a sophisticated and crucial environment.
Excellent oral and written communications skills required.
Oversees the documentation of all development activity.

Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a Senior Software Development and Systems Integration Engineer on the Enterprise IT Infrastructure team, you will be responsible for all aspects of the plan, build, run and maintenance of our pro-active monitoring tools and data centers as well as adding intelligence to systems and data to deliver practical solution for the business. The team is a small and fast-moving team of best-in-class authorities who are innovating in pro-active monitoring technology delivery for Comcast Business Service Assurance. We are a team that flourishes with big challenges, results, quality, and agility.
Job Description
Join a forward-thinking team of engineers who can influence the business by delivering technology and tools that directly impact Comcast Business customers. On this team you will not only be an evangelist for tools and technology the business partners rely on, but also get exposure to the latest industry solutions.


Designing, solutioning and implementing the business /product features
Be the SME (and the Go To person) for the Monitoring tools/solutions.
Writing high quality production-ready application code.
Pairing and collaborating with peers.
Writing appropriate levels of documentation, API specifications.
Participating in joint design and architecture sessions with Network engineering team
Be part of our Agile development team and participate in bi-weekly sprints
Ensuring high security posture across the solutions footprint and carry out to Comcast Business security standard methodologies
Building effective Continuous integration, near time Delivery & Deployment model with confirmed operations monitoring capabilities.
Establish operations excellency by reducing the MTTR and measuring the platform resiliency against the Error Budget
Ensuring timely remediation for keeping the platforms & apps secured.
An eye for strong automation and Toil reduction focus
Operating and supporting production environments (including on-call support once out of each month which is infrequent)
Performing Design and code reviews as needed
Participating in software release and deployment activities.
Coordinating constructively with other team members and external teams.
Take lead/pride in supporting/guiding the internal/external partners while integrating with the platform


10+ years of significant work experience, including extensive programming experience and mentoring skills.
BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field or 5+ equivalent professional experience
We favor experience in multiple languages over expertise in any given language. However, experience in Python is most likely to be most effective to the team.
Experience developing architectures and an understanding of design for scalability, performance, and reliability.
Knowledge of Database querying, self-management of DB operations a plus (MySQL/Redis).
Experience on a DevOps team working with monitoring systems such as Zabbix, Grafana, Splunk, or the ELK Stack.
Knowledgeable with ETL tools like Apache NiFi
Ability to navigate to custom and machine logs to triage and drive issues resolution will be very useful
facility with command command-line utilities; familiarity with system administration tools and concepts a plus.
Experience integrating Open-Source tools and libraries to build complete solutions.
Experience with application clustering, load balancing, high availability, and reliability concepts and supporting technologies.
Experience with high-scale, distributed web service development (hands-on experience with RESTful/web services).
Understanding of Machine learning principles and technology.
Familiarity with distributed systems, asynchronous messaging, and network protocols, especially SNMP, ICMP and HTTPS.
Experience working with automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Terraform.
Understanding of TCP/IP networking protocols (SNMPv3, ICMP, BGP…) and data formats like HTTP, JDBC, JSON, YAML.
Experience with Open-source solutions for messaging, load balancing, and database software (Kafka, Redis, Elasticsearch).
Experience leading applications and infrastructure resources, services for production systems.
Ability to communicate authoritatively and collegially with technical and management colleagues and team members.
A passion for providing excellent service to all internal and external customers.

Title: Comcast Cybersecurity: Python Engineer, Microsegmentation
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Open source software is a crucial part of all modern engineering cultures. Comcast's technology strategy relies on a solid set of practices around open source, both in effectively using open source to achieve our goals and in making contributions back to the open source community. As the Senior Director of the Comcast OSPO, you'll evolve the practices we have in place to be good citizens of the open source community. As a part of the Comcast TPX DevX: Strategy team, you are a vital member of the Comcast Cable CTO's organization. Our team focuses on technology strategy, engineering culture, and developer experience. We drive technology invention and innovation that advances the state of the art and catalyzes growth opportunities for Comcast. We collaborate across TPX to define and accelerate Comcast's technology strategy, and we engage externally with a variety of partners and communities to co-create the future of technology. We are a diverse group of customer-centric, curious risk-takers, willing to disrupt ourselves and others and driven by a desire to create engineering excellence. You will lead a group of technical program managers in the Comcast OSPO. Your team focuses on all aspects of open source license compliance, strategies around Comcast's usage and engagement with open source, and methods to bring open source engineering practices into our engineering culture. Together, these actions will shape their path to broader adoption of open source in Comcast. They are an integral part of our technology and developer experience strategy. Your stakeholders are both internal and external. The Comcast OSPO has deep partnerships with our legal and security teams, and your responsibilities include cultivating and growing those relationships. Engineering teams across the Comcast landscape will look to you for guidance on effectively using open source software. You'll partner with the engineers and their leadership to manage contributions to cornerstone open source programs. As we achieve success in each area, you'll share those stories in the open source community to gather feedback and bolster Comcast's engineering brand.
Job Description Core Responsibilities
Build open source license compliance into our engineering culture, using technology and process solutions where each is appropriate.
Cultivate a strong community inside Comcast around open source usage and being good open source community members.
Connect with cross functional teams including the legal and engineering to
Maintain Comcast’s external presence in the open source community through speaking engagements and involvement with open source foundations.
Champion the benefits of open source throughout Comcast.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering, or similar field; or equivalent experience preferred
5+ years’ experience managing and leading a team
A deep understanding of the open source community's history, principles, and standard methodologies.
3+ years of relevant experience in open source license compliance, with an understanding of different open source license types and the ability to communicate to the engineering community the applicability of each.
3+ years of experience establishing open source procedures for cloud-native engineering cultures.
Ability to engage effectively with partners at all levels, from executive stakeholders to engineers who are making open source contributions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong public speaking skills with the ability to effectively communicate in large groups or meetings
Preferred Qualifications
A relationship to the open source community through participation in conferences or foundations.
Validated ability to lead large programs.
Proven success in building influence and positive relationships across a large organization with many cross-functional stakeholders.

Job Summary Responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing security measures for information systems to regulate access to computer data files and prevent unauthorized modification, destruction, or disclosure of information. Evaluates emerging and available technologies to enable systems and users to securely share information with customers. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Designs an in-depth architecture focusing on core security services at the host and network layers. Includes baseline secure configurations in addition to applicable authentication, authorization, logging, audit, encryption and monitoring components.

Documents and keeps current all information security issues, control gates and the security review processes in place.
Performs risk analysis of tested and evaluated networks and systems.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

At Databricks, we are passionate about enabling data teams to solve the world's toughest problems, from security threat detection to cancer drug development. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform, so our customers can focus on the high value challenges that are central to their own missions. Title: Data & Privacy Vendor Specialist
Job_Description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. Job Summary The Data & Privacy Vendor Specialist works closely with the Partnership team, Legal and Privacy Compliance & Security teams within Comcast Advertising. They are responsible for supporting Comcast Advertising Partnership teams and their extensive portfolio of vendor and partner relationships with a primary focus on privacy and information security compliance. Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Regular, consistent and punctual attendance.

A compliance, system architecture, or info-security background; data privacy qualification (GDPR & CCPA) preferred

Highly detail-oriented, organized, proactive, efficient, and resourceful with exceptional follow-through skills

Excellent communication and collaboration skills

An analytical mind, the ability to solve complex problems and streamline processes

Ability to simultaneously manage workloads, multiple client demands, and shifting priorities within a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environment

Experience in drafting data flows, procedures, and manuals

Comfortable reading legal contracts and security assessments

Job Summary The Endpoint Detection Response Analyst is a highly motivated individual with a passion for research and uncovering cybersecurity threats. This person is capable to communicate about security vulnerabilities and remediation techniques and improve the security program and our customer's trust. The EDR analyst is the expert in detection and incident response disciplines, current threats, modern attacker exploits and persistence techniques.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities

Monitor key Endpoint Detection and Response clients until “Safe for Handoff”, EDR only clients until fine-tuned, and white-glove EDR clients.

Handles issues and calls pertaining to large EDR customers, EDR only customers, white-glove EDR clients

Handle all Threat Hunting customers with reports, new IOC searches, time tracking, news, wins, etc.

Conduct audits for all EDR and TH customers, provide reports to manager, and collaborate with other teams for training.

Monitor customer satisfaction through survey results, comments, references for TH and EDR monitoring.

Handles the maintenance of Parsers, rules, reports, dashboards, provisioning, deployment help and documentation.

Conducts reviews on canned verbiage, service review support if necessary and TH reports.

Run training on EDR IR’s (good/bad), confluence knowledge / how to’s, expand analyst engagement and skill sets.

Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and alerts to identify potential threats, vulnerabilities, and technical risks.

Coordinate with the Threat Intelligence team on current threats and TTP.

Breach and incident support.

Additional duties as assigned.

Helps ensure that customer SLAs are met at all times. Responds quickly to downtime situations.
Communicates regularly with development and supports teams regarding system status and implementation schedules.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

Title: Data & Privacy Vendor Specialist
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.

The VIPER team is an organization within Comcast’s grander Technology Product and Experience organization (TPX) which supports the Product Management, Research & Development, Engineering and Operations for Comcast’s Exceptional Video Experiences in use by Comcast and Syndicated Partners. We support both legacy QAM Video Delivery and the Next Generation IP Video Platform infrastructure from Content Acquisition to the Player consuming experiences we control the end-to-end Video delivery platforms. These platforms deliver video for live linear, video on-demand and cloud DVR services consumed by more than 20 million customers both in-home and out of home on stb’s, connected tv, mobile and desktop products.

Job Summary Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
Job Description
Do you love to write code? Are you passionate about software craftsmanship? Would you like to work on projects with tangible impact?

As a software Engineer you will work with a complementary team of architects, software engineers, product owners, service delivery engineers, and care-agents to develop, document, and deploy the software that delivers a superior customer care experience to Comcast residential, business, and sales agents across the world.
The E360 Delivery team is a fast paced group of elite specialists who are innovating accessible, efficient UX design that boosts agent and customer satisfaction scores. We are a team that solves big challenges, provides results, focuses on quality, and value agility.

Who does the E360 engineer work with?
E360 software architects collaborate with engineers from many teams: software engineers within E360 and across Comcast. An E360 architect also engages with quality assurance engineers, technical operators, architects, and product owners daily and senior leaders of the organization occasionally.

Where can you make an impact?
Your code will deliver the product that serves millions of Comcast customers all day, every day. The modules you design and build will enable product features that are pioneering the next generation of customer care products. You can help influence technology standards with real world lessons learned by being a first implementer. Replace expensive vendor provided solutions with better, more stable, more scalable, more operable platforms, and see that your individual contributions will have multi-million-dollar impacts to the bottom line. And that is just the beginning. We have just begun development on the next evolution of our platform, Celestial, which will use an upgraded technology stack to provide highly available, accessible, role customizable, and CMS-driven content across channels on both mobile and web platforms.


Design new software applications, support applications under development, and customize existing applications. Develop software update process for existing applications. Assist in the rollout of software releases including testing automation and improvement.

Design, document, and maintain diagrams for systems, processes, interfaces, and scheduling.

Collaborates with project customers to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.

Diagnose performance issues and propose and implement code improvements

Prove scalability with load generating tools

Ensure the software architecture is lean and extensible

Ensure software modules are reliable for reuse

Works with Quality and Performance Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification needs.



Angular, React, NGRX, SASS, Prism, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, CSS3; Layout rendering from SiteCore,

Kotlin, GraphQL, , Microsoft .NET technology stack tools and IDEs (C# programming language preferred).

Couchbase, MS SQL

TestCafe, Jest, Protractor, SonarQube, lighthouse, ARC, AxCore, CICD using Concourse

Skills & Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Equivalent. 5-7 years directly related experience may be considered in-lieu of degree(s)

Fluency in web application development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks to solve UI problems.

Expertise with semantic markup, responsive design, and CSS 3 web layout models such as Flexbox.

Comfortable with (or willing to learn) Microsoft .NET technology tools, Kotlin

Competence in SASS, Angular and React development, and Storybook.

At least 4 years’ software development experience with a recent focus on cloud computing (preferably Azure)

Comfortable working in a fast-paced agile environment

Good communicator; able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies understandably and engagingly

A strong bias for automation

Strong problem-solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take accountability.

Experience mentoring junior engineers

About E360
Einstein is a product within Comcast’s Technology, Product and Experience division. E360 is an in-house developed CARE tools platform that is changing how care agents interact our customers by superior UX design and a seamlessly uniform experience.

The Cloud Security team is a highly visible team within the Comcast Cyber Security organization responsible for the security of Comcast’s multiple public and private cloud offerings. The impact the Cloud Security team has throughout the Comcast ecosystem is significant as we work to develop new solutions to complex security problems while reducing the impact on cloud developers’ day to day activities. Additionally, our team offers significant growth opportunities with the ability to work in a multidisciplinary security environment interacting and learning from all aspects of the security landscape. The Cloud Security Engineer is responsible for developing security prototypes and proof of concepts which demonstrate strategic security vision. You will work closely with strategic security architects and other key stakeholders to help transform technical vision into implementable security solutions for all aspects of the Comcast brand. In this role you will also perform security product evaluations and efficacy reviews. Additionally, you will act as a lead technologist on security initiatives identified by the Comcast security leadership team and security strategy organization.
Job Description


The ideal candidate for this role is self-motivated and enjoys digging into the details to find problems and propose solutions. They are open to improvement and regular constructive feedback on how to improve themselves and their work and able to offer similar feedback to other team members. They possess emotional intelligence and can empathize with others providing appropriate support where needed. They are self-aware and able to articulate their current struggles, goals, feelings, and needs in a way that fosters open and trusting communication.

This role is particularly interested in the management of the platforms rather than the use of or experience deploying solutions on the platforms


Relevant cloud & cyber security certifications, such as GCP/Azure Architect, CISSP, CISM, CISA, CCSP, GIAC are highly desired
Current experience and deep knowledge around the management GCP, Azure, and container technologies
Hands on experience with Azure or GCP with a focus on security controls (Security Groups, Access Control Policies, API Security)
Ability to develop prototypes in common programing languages is a plus (Python, ruby, go, etc.)
Familiarity with API integration for Azure or GCP
Experience working with Security DevOps teams to integrate security into Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment environments
Expertise in security development and solution engineering, security operations management, incident management, governance and solution delivery and life-cycle management
Technical and practical knowledge of enterprise networking, security risks of cloud computing, log aggregation and correlation
Process and procedure knowledge of governance, compliance, risk management and audit control systems and functions
High level of personal integrity, with the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and exudes the appropriate level of judgment and maturity in all situations
Superb written and oral communication skills
Proficient knowledge of NIST, PCI, SOX and other cyber security standards is a plus


A collaborative/supportive environment fostering challenge and growth
Excellent salary, comprehensive benefits, bonus opportunity, stock, 401k match, Comcast perks and much more

Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.

Job Summary Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers.


The Comcast DPA team is looking for a DevOps engineer who loves working with new technology and has a passion for working on highly performing distributed applications that process billions of transactions per day. Our platform utilizes Kafka and Cassandra for data streaming and storage, ElasticSearch and Kibana for LaaS, and Telegraf, Prometheus, and Grafana for MaaS. Our software is written mostly in Java, with some C/C++ and Scala as well. The platform stores real time device provisioning data used in advanced advertising, fraud mitigation, and auto authentication.

As a DevOps engineer, you will be responsible for the design, development, testing, installation, monitoring and troubleshooting of software running on our Big Data platforms and utilizing data streaming technologies.

A successful candidate will have an established background in large scale service-oriented applications running on hundreds of servers in multiple data centers. You should have strong technical ability, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.


Manage the deployment and configuration of hundreds of servers
Install and deploy software
Design, develop and test software applications.
Set up monitoring systems for all new hardware and software
Perform and automate, and monitor daily database backups and maintenance
Automate and maintain disaster recovery procedures, user assistance and troubleshooting
Automate repetitive tasks.
Configure and manage the automated deployment process
Work with the Quality Assurance team to determine if applications meet technical requirements
Diagnose performance issues both in the lab and in production, and propose and implement improvements
Analyze and resolve complex technical problems, particularly pertaining to Big Data products and applications
Plan database and server level capacity according to statistics and user requests
Provide 24x7 on-call production support


5 years of experience in Linux administration, memory, file systems, networking and debugging.
3+ years of experience with Cassandra.
3+ years of programming skills in Shell Scripting, Python and Perl.
3+ years of experience with Kafka (administration, configuration, troubleshooting).
Deep understanding of certificate management, TLS troubleshooting, single sign-on, encryption ciphers and key management.
3+ years of hands-on experience of using standard CICD/devops tools such as GitHub, Ansible, and build tools like Concourse, Jenkins.
Excellent in troubleshooting Java application and network related issues.
Excellent communication skills, both verbally and written.
Experience in writing technical system admin guides, installation guides and troubleshooting guides.
Knowledge of cloud computing technologies (AWS, Azure, CloudFoundry, etc.).
BS in computer science, computer engineering.


Working knowledge of network principles such as DNS, DHCP and TFTP is desired.
Experience with LaaS Stack (Elastic Search, logstash, Kibana) for monitoring.
Experience with Prometheus and Grafana collection and monitoring.
Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker.
Experience with NoSQL (Mongo, Redis, etc.).

About SoFA
The service Fulfillment & Assurance platform team is responsible for enabling services to customers, including High-Speed Internet data, Voice, Video, and Home security LOB(S). The platform supports different capabilities to provision and activates services. It leads the complete lifecycle of the fulfillment procedures, including back-office and fallout management.

Experience leading enterprise-level programs and projects A greater understanding of Architecture and Design principles Experience leading/managing application platforms on public or private cloud Familiarity with carrying out cloud migration strategies on public cloud or private cloud Experience with working on telephone provisioning Proven experience meeting significant deliverables with fixed and ambitious deadlines

We’re looking for a software engineer to help us bring Notion to the world. You’ll be an individual contributor on the software engineering team, working on a range of technologies, including distributed computing, Internet of Things security, and more. You’ll be working closely with fast-paced and highly skilled individuals across the whole SoFA team.

Core Responsibilities
Collaborates with project collaborators to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.
Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Develops software update process for existing applications. Assists in the roll-out of software releases.
Trains junior Software Development Engineers on internally developed software applications.
Is responsible for the researching, writing and editing of documentation and technical requirements, including evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Keeps current with technological developments within the industry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques. Serves as a guide and mentor for junior level Software Development Engineers.
Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team delivers software on time, to specification and within budget.
Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements.
Displays expertise in knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts and skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.
Displays expertise in process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal audiences.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Title: Engineer 3, Software Dev and Engineering
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a Cloud Solution Architect, you will partner with application teams to architect secure, resilient, and performant solutions on Comcast’s private cloud platforms across a variety of business use cases. The Comcast Cloud Technologies team develops and delivers cloud technologies and services that enable Comcast organizations to transform their businesses through innovation.


The Comcast Cloud Technologies (CCT) organization at Comcast develops, delivers and operates cloud technologies and services to help Comcast organizations digitally transform their businesses and convert technology challenges into innovation opportunities.
We do this through our culture by leading with trust in our teams through empowerment, accountability, and empathy. We ask our team to manage through change by remaining furiously customer centric, maintain our ability to be open, and striving for transparent with ourselves and each other. Additionally, we ask our team to continuously evolve through’ learning, being reliable and retaining flexibility.


As a technology centric and end to end customer experience driven company, Comcast has embarked on a daring journey to embrace cloud computing and cloud-based technologies across its entire business.
With this goal in mind, over the last several years, many Engineering organizations across Comcast have begun to leverage cloud solutions and services to modernize their infrastructures and establish their future platforms for innovation.


Partner with application teams to help architect secure, resilient, and performant solutions on our private cloud platforms
Coach and educate engineering teams on cloud concepts and best practices
Build prototypes, publish design patterns for use by the organization
Provide guidance on cloud migration techniques including the 6 R’s
Work closely with and provide feedback to the cloud product team to ensure our private cloud offerings meet the growing needs of the applications that depend on it
Evaluate technical risks and develop mitigation strategies for application team architectures and the private cloud platform
Create tooling for the private cloud platform that can be leveraged by application teams to ease their adoption and integration


Chance to learn new technologies and services
Ability to impact Comcast success at scale across a variety of business use cases
To be creative and build innovative solutions for challenging technical problems
Opportunity to present internally and externally
A flexible work environment
A fun, diverse and inclusive organization

Who does the cloud solution architect work with?
Cloud solution architects work across the Comcast organization with engineers and leaders to enable building products and services for a variety of use cases and leverage their experience internally with the Comcast Cloud Technologies team to provide feedback and guidance to continuously improve our cloud product offerings.

What are some exciting problems you’ll be working on?
In your role you will enable application teams to deliver Comcast’s products and services at massive scale leveraging cloud technologies by engaging with teams to design innovative cloud architectures that solve challenging business problems.

Where can you make an impact?
Comcast’s mission is to create incredible technology and entertainment that connects millions of people to the moments that matter. You’ll be working with some of the brightest minds in Comcast as we continue our cloud journey to reduce time to market and improve our products and services through cloud adoption.


Strong understanding of cloud technologies
Experience architecting solutions in a cloud environment
Able to apply concepts of the well-architected frameworks for private cloud
Practical experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform
Understanding of cloud identity and access management (IAM) concepts and services
Understanding of VMWare and experience deploying to VMware environment a plus
Experience deploying on and operating Kubernetes a plus
Practical experience deploying to a public cloud a plus (AWS, GCP, Azure) a plus
Understanding of cloud/networking and protocols such as TCP/UDP, ICMP
Software development experience and understanding of SDL concepts a plus
Experience troubleshooting issues in large scale Cloud environments a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Capable of presenting to diverse groups of individuals
Ability to develop relationships and work across multiple teams and organizations

We are agile and seek continuous improvement
We take our work seriously, but do not take ourselves too seriously
We are passionate about winning together
We treat customers as partners rather than as tickets to be closed
We value delivering solutions now with iterative refinement

The requirements are intended as a guideline only. If you are motivated and interested in jumping into something new, believe you can bring a fresh opinion to our culture and enjoy solving daring problems, then you should apply.
We value critical thinking, self-motivation, and the ability to be successful in an ambiguous and less-structured environment
We love people who are intellectually curious, apply data to make decisions, innovate, elevate the performance of those around them, and like to win as a team
We want you to be passionate about delivering an excellent customer experience and understand how the work you do connects to the customer
Exceptional business judgement demonstrating strong critical thinking complemented with a bias for action and execution/operational excellence
Excellent analytical problem-solving skills and ability to synthesize data from multiple sources to drive data-driven decisions
An engineering degree or public cloud certification is not required, but you should have strong technical capability, passion for technology, and the ability to connect with engineering teams, finance, and technical leadership

The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia).
