The Sr. Windows Engineer is responsible for planning and designing complex Windows infrastructure. The engineer analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new solutions and the documentation of all development activities. They will train non-technical personnel and assist with supervising performance metrics and integrating knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a catalyst in a sophisticated and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and share expertise. About DevX Platforms The goal in DevX Platforms is to provide teams with tools that help deliver and manage their systems. This entails creating and maintaining infrastructure services and platforms that app teams can use as services. Who does the engineer work with? An engineer on the DevX Platforms team can expect to work with cross-functional teams within Comcast, including: Collaborating with DevOps engineers to understand their use cases so that we can build tools and processes to simplify their workflow Subject matter experts to identify best practices for implementing our products and services Organization architects to share solution designs and gather feedback on higher-level goals Cybersecurity to ensure our solutions are adhering to security standards and enabling other teams to meet security standards What are some interesting problems you’ll be working on? Creating solutions to enable secure, hardened, and patchable OS images running on multiple platforms, including physical hardware, private clouds, and public clouds Enabling other teams to deploy and configure their VM-based workloads Opportunity to use new technologies and platforms

We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast. Are you interested in solving natural language problems that involve speech and text utterances from millions of customers and hundreds of thousands of video content? Do you have experience in building large-scale speech, NLP and machine learning systems? Do you want to conduct industry-leading applied research to create voice assistants to help millions of households interact with video and music content on their TV, PC, Phone, and Mobile devices as well as troubleshoot problems without human intervention? If yes, come join the he Comcast Applied AI & Discovery organization. We are an innovative research group within Comcast's Technology & Product organization with offices in Washington, DC, Silicon Valley, Philadelphia, Denver and Chicago that does groundbreaking research to support the development of novel Deep Learning, Speech and Natural Language Processing based products for Comcast's 22+ Million consumers.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.

Company Description

NBCUniversal owns and operates over 20 different businesses across 30 countries including a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, world-renowned theme parks and a premium ad-supported streaming service.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. We strive to foster a diverse and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. We believe that our workforce should represent the communities we live in, so that together, we can continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world. Click here to learn more about Comcast NBCUniversal’s commitment and how we are making an impact.

Comcast is looking for a talented and dedicated Software Development Engineer to support the setup, configuration and maintenance of tools eco system to enhance the development of CPE devices. CPE development business is responsible for project deliveries and innovation initiatives for the devices that uses Comcast’s Reference Design Kit (RDK), which is deployed at Comcast on over 15 million devices spanning video and broadband. Comcast’s development environment is advanced and highly integrated. It uses industry standard tools that are combined effectively to support a fast-moving, agile development cycle. The combination of these tools running on cloud infrastructure, coupled with an effective use of Open Source code, allows Comcast to deliver features and products against aggressive timelines.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Job_Description:
Effectv, the advertising sales division of Comcast Cable, helps local, regional and national advertisers use the best of digital with the power of TV to grow their business. It provides multi-screen marketing solutions to make advertising campaigns more effective and easier to execute. Headquartered in New York with offices throughout the country, Effectv has a presence in 66 markets with nearly 35 million owned and represented subscribers. We’re dedicated to helping our clients meet their business goals by connecting them with their customers through multiscreen television advertising. Working with companies from local startups to nationwide corporations, we provide support to help each business reach its target customers. By applying data to television advertising in new ways, we’re able to bring our clients the best of digital media, coupled with the power of TV. To learn more, check out www.effectv.com.

Job Summary
Are you a motivated and driven DevOps Engineer with an interest in working in multi-cloud environments? Do you have a penchant for automation and a desire to be a part of a team which builds secure, scalable and robust applications using cutting edge technical solutions and the environments that house these solutions? If so, here is a fantastic opportunity in the fast growing world of advanced advertising where you will be responsible for planning and designing new cloud-based software and web applications, analyze, test and assist with the integration of new applications and oversee documentation of the environment. You will assist with tracking performance metrics and helping set up robust monitoring and alerting mechanisms for your applications.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.

Job Summary
Customer Experience Technologies (CXT) is passionate about the technology, systems and tools that support the customer lifecycle (sales, activation, billing, support, etc.), as well as employee-facing teams such as human resources, finance, and workplace information technology. These tools and systems are foundational to our ability to meet and exceed customer expectations and support an excellent employee experience. The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies. The (BSD) Business Service Delivery unit is the heart of this mission.

Comcast Technology Solutions is the leading provider of online video publishing, management and delivery solutions. We help many of the world’s largest broadcasters, cable operators and media companies manage video content and deliver on demand and live streaming content to set-top boxes, online and mobile clients. Those customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, CNBC, National Geographic, Comcast, BT, CBC, Travel Channel, Weather Company and more. As strategic business unit of Comcast, we enjoy the benefits of a large company while keeping the agility of a startup. The Content and Streaming Providers Cloud Video Platform team handles video processing, discovery, video management and distribution throughout in the US, EU and World. You will contribute to evolving a highly automated, scalable and globally available service using various cloud technologies. We practice DevOps, operating what we build, supported by talented infrastructure and support teams. We value cultural fit, intelligence, self-motivation, empathy and a passion for learning as much as experience. If this sounds like a role you would enjoy, but you’re concerned about specific details below, please apply anyway. You might be the perfect person for us.

Responsible for leading a team of data engineering and operations developers; coordinating and directing the design, development, implementation, maintenance and support of data engineering solutions. Also, coordinating analysis that ensures the development of business and consumer insights, recommendations that address business objectives and a strategic understanding of data collected. Title: Backend Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview:
Datatron is a cutting-edge, MLOps / ModelOps platform for machine learning model deployment, life-cycle management, and governance. Our vision is to give enterprises experience the tremendous benefits of AI by giving them state-of-the-art MLOps toolsets that are typically found in large cloud players. We are defining the future of model operations and we are just getting started. We are committed to models coming to life in production, and most importantly, staying alive and accurate.
As more and more enterprise companies begin AI programs and leverage Machine Learning to help improve customer experiences and revenue, the opportunity has massive growth potential. Datatron is primed to capitalize on this opportunity. We have built a platform that has already solved major AI/ML pain points for Fortune 100 enterprise brands like Comcast and Domino’s. Datatron helps businesses get more AI/ML models into production faster, delivering business value in less time while providing critical governance for models in production.
Respected industry analysts like Gartner, who have surveyed the competitive landscape, have indicated that Datatron’s product is at the vanguard of the pack. Backed by world-class tier-1 investors. We have proven value, demonstrated by our Fortune 100 clientele. We are in a growth phase and are scaling out teams across the company.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
Job Summary Responsible for transforming large, complex data into consumable business databases and applications for self-service analytics and reporting. Create system architecture, design and specification using in-depth engineering skills and knowledge to solve difficult development problems and achieve engineering goals. Works closely with a variety of team members to clearly define data product requirements and technical roadmaps. Determine and source appropriate data for a given analysis. Work with data modelers/analysts to understand the business problems they are trying to solve then create or augment data assets to feed their analysis. Acts as a technical expert in own area within the organization. May work independently or as part of a team on more complex projects. Provides mentoring and guidance to more junior team members. May be responsible for leading a team, but does not directly manage people.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Defines technical roadmap and participates in the development of business strategy.
Designs and architects databases and applications and leads each project through implementation, using in-depth understanding of product life cycle and industry technical knowledge.
Solves complex engineering problems where analysis of situation or business knowledge does not adequately define the problem and requires a deep understanding of the solution architecture and industry expertise to help frame the business question in engineering terms.
Acts as a subject matter expert in one or more technical areas; such as data architecture, data engineering or data manipulation within big data systems like Hadoop (Kafka, Spark, Ambari and Hawk), SQL and HiveQL. Uses fluency in primary technology and proficiencies in one or more secondary technologies to support adoption of additional or new technologies' by the team.
Serves as a team leader on projects spanning different engineering disciplines within the organization. Provides consultative direction and develops long-term objectives and plans on tactical and strategic issues.
Develops resources plans for senior management which support department initiatives and goals.
Acts as a liaison between business owners and technical associates to ensure the data collected and processed is both actionable and relevant to the end goals.
Collaborates with technology and platform management partners to optimize data sourcing and processing rules to ensure appropriate data quality.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.


This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.

Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.

Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law.
Education
Bachelor's Degree
While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.
Relevant Work Experience
7-10 Years
Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the worlds best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. Job Summary Responsible for transforming large, complex data into consumable business databases and applications for self-service analytics and reporting. Create system architecture, design and specification using in-depth engineering skills and knowledge to solve difficult development problems and achieve engineering goals. Determine and source appropriate data for a given analysis. Work with data modelers/analysts to understand the business problems they are trying to solve then create or augment data assets to feed their analysis. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
Role Description
Full Time position that is responsible for the design, development, testing, and support of the Big Data Analytics solutions on cloud (AWS)in collaboration with cross functional teams.
Collaborate with key stake holders and translate business requirements to technical requirements and implement solutions under the guidance of technical leads.
Dive into large, noisy, and complex real-world customer TV and Digital Ad viewing data to do pre-campaign planning and post campaigns performance measurement using Big data Platform (DataBricks, Pyspark, Glue, EMR).
Responsible for building data pipelines to ingest data, integrate data from multiple data sources (On-Premise & Cloud) and create aggregated data sets for reporting needs.

Qualifications


Strong understanding of database structures, query languages (e.g. SQL), fundamentals of mathematics, distributed systems (Hadoop), data science, and statistical concepts.
Experience consolidating and integrating data from multiple sources (On-Premise & Cloud).
Ability to analyze, transform and aggregate large data sets (Big Data) using BI tools (Hive QL, Pyspark, Jupyter Notebooks, AWS Athena, AWS Glue).
Ability to automate PySpark Jobs using Lambda/Glue/EMR/Python and fine tune for performance.
Ability to Architect and Design Big Data Analytics solutions on cloud (AWS).
Knowledge of Media/Advertising industry.


Experience sharing insights and recommendations to audiences with varying levels of analytic understanding
Ability to communicate complex concepts in easy-to-understand terminology
Team player with a “can-do” attitude
“Lean forward” bias to find opportunities and drive results
Ability to work effectively across functions, disciplines, and levels


BS or MS degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field of study


5+ years of Hands-on experience in Big Data Analytics geared towards BI insights.
3+ years of Hands-on experience working on data pipelines, automation of jobs using big data technologies (Spark, Python, Pyspark, Glue).
3+ years of experience working with Linux, DataBricks, and Azkaban or similar tools.
Strong knowledge of SQL, Python and relational databases.
Knowledge of AWS services such as Glue, Athena, Lambda, EC2, IAM, CloudWatch, EMR, S3 and Big data Query engines like Hive, Presto, Spark.
Hands-on experience working with Big Data and building Data Analytics solutions on Cloud (AWS).


Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary The Comcast Reactor organization is responsible for developing, operating, and maintaining Comcast’s Change, Incident, and Problem management focus tools and technologies. Our goal is provide us customers with tools and data insights that can stimulate efficient conversations on how to tackle and solve the next big challenge in a highly collaborative environment. The Engineer, Reporting and Data Management will take on a hybrid Reporting and data management position driving business-critical initiatives. The person in this role will be exposed to high impact and high visibility analytical demands. Provides input or may prepare complex/intricate reports/presentations based on the interpretation of analyzed data.
Job Description


Design, maintain and deploy consumable, interactive, and thought-provoking dashboards for operational and management decision-making
Apply business intelligence and analytics tools to build and visualize information for Senior Stakeholders (i.e. using ServiceNow Reporting Module, Tableau, and Excel or another visualization tool (s)).
Extract, transform and load data and perform data analysis using MS SQL Server and AWS-based technologies
Assist in the preparation of internal reporting, senior management reports, and specialized reporting on an ad-hoc basis
Evaluate data quality metrics and data quality audits to benchmark the state of data quality
Implement and enforce data governance standards and procedures
Identify new data sources and develop recommendations for assessing the quality of new data
Partner with groups and various levels of seniority to coordinate and drive collaboration on solution design and remediation execution


Demonstrates critical thinking and perspective in problem-resolution
Develop business relationships and partnerships with multi-functional targeted business owners and senior leaders across the organization.
Educate other team members, associates, and leaders across the firm on data and statistical concepts and standard methodologies


5-7 years of experience
Self-motivated with a good mix of technical, coding, and data analysis skills
Ability to lead cross-departmental teams in design, testing, and implementation.
Architecture background would be considered a PLUS
Preferred experience with Tableau, SQL, ServiceNow, AWS, and ETL Tools
Strong willingness to learn and development
Good interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
Job Summary We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Engineering and Operations team. Engineers are responsible for assisting with the architecture design and building the ETL pipeline of our master data assets. Our tech stack includes Spark, Python, Databricks, Kubernetes, AWS, MinIO, Teradata and Airflow. An ideal candidate has 3-6 years of experience in building Big Data pipelines, has experience with spark and has strong SQL skills. We are a highly collaborative team; we partner with our data stewards and architects to design optimized data solutions that are generally available company-wide, leveraged by our team of analysts, and feed dashboards built by our reporting team. Candidates should be self-directed and comfortable moving between multiple projects as needs change. If you are looking to grow your technical expertise, and gain experience in leading and developing junior team members we would like to hear from you.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Supports the architecture, design, development, qualification and deployment of applications consistent with product and technical roadmaps.
Works with engineering project management and principle engineers to deliver applications that meet or exceed product requirements, project schedules and reliability.
Develops and applies performance and bandwidth models for interactive applications to document network impacts.
Works with the product development and operations teams to define technical requirements to accompany existing product and operation requirements. Designs and develops use cases in support of the technical requirements. Transforms technical requirements into architectures.
Defines and documents a detailed design to meet technical requirements and architecture.
Assists in vendor technical selection and management including input to specifications and vendor evaluation. Interfaces with outside teams in the development of internal and third party software to support the detailed designs.
Interfaces with Company test teams to validate Company test plans and procedures are representative of fully exercising and validating the product features and capabilities.
Works closely with development, integration and test teams to ensure product quality. Prepares deliverables for trial and market readiness.
Drives the continuous improvement of deployed systems by consistently looking for ways to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
Supports operations by providing deployment and sustained engineering support for all responsible systems and technologies. Diagnoses and resolves escalated field issues.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Job Summary As part of Comcast 5G Core Architecture & Design Team, the Core A&D SME will join the team of passionate engineers with start-up spirit to test, deploy and debug Comcasts’s standalone 5G network. The candidate should bring innovation and strong execution skills to help architect, deploy & implement Comcast’s Mobile Data Networks.
Job Description


5G Core SME- ( Subscriber Data Management ) w ill be responsible for the introduction, solutioning, building high and low level designs, and identifying all related parameters, timers and configurations of :

Unified Data Repository (UDR );

Unified data management (UDM) , Authentication Credential Repository and Processing Function (ARPF) and Subscriber Identity De- concealing Function (SIDF)

Hardware Security Module (HSM AuC ) .

Authentication Server Function (AUSF) .

Home Subscriber Server (HSS) .

Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting ( 3GPP AAA) server .

that make up the Subscriber Data Management (SDM), which is part of the Standalone 5G Core (5GC).

The 5G Core SME-( SDM ) will be also responsible for building the test cases procedures and objectives and overseeing the testing and validation of new software releases of the applications that make up the SDM at both a component-level and from an end-to-end perspective, and collaborating with the centralized Operations to drive the First Office Applications (FOAs) in the production network. And a ble to prepare 5G Core test strategy, test plan and test execution of new network uses cases.

Engages with vendor personnel regarding new services and features as well as upgrades.

Ensures that solutions adhere to defined standards and best practices and/or assist in the development of these standards and best practices.

Routinely researches, analyzes, tests, retests, and troubleshoots complex problems.

Participates in knowledge transfer, documentation and information sharing while staying abreast of new technology/technical areas.


Expertise with 3GPP and other relevant standards for mobile networks

Expert knowledge in 5G Subscriber Data Management (SDM) related technologies , platforms and procedures .

Expert knowledge in 5G subscriber authentication framework and 5G SIM keys management.

Expert knowledge in SDM provisioning solutions.

Expert knowledge in 5G SBA architecture, and Nudr interfaces.

Expert knowledge in 5G in LDAP based databases.

Expert knowledge in SDM systems geo redundancy, availability, resiliency and data replication and synchronization.

Core network protocols used for 5G Core and EPC Network

Plan and build test lab environments for functionality and performance testing.

PCF)

Offline / Online Charging architectures (such as PCRF Gx and OCS Gy , interfaces)

AAA, RADIUS, Diameter, EAP -AKA , 5G-AKA, LTE, 5G. Experience using protocol communications test equipment and tools (protocol analyzers, LTE system simulators, analyzers and packet sniffers).
Exposure to commercial test simulators and test systems such as Spirent, Aeroflex , Tektronix

Strong knowledge of Wireshark or other IP protocol analyzer

Good IP knowledge and routing protocol, IPv4, IPv6, Dual-Stack, TCP/IP, UDP, VLAN, IPSec , NAT, IP forwarding

Good Knowledge in cloud native principles, virtualization , containerization, orchestration, Kubernetes, openstack , etc ..

Knowledge in Nokia Subscriber Data Layer (SDL), and other SDM elements is a great plus.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services."
Job Summary Responsible for transforming large, complex data into consumable business databases and applications for self-service analytics and reporting. Create system architecture, design and specification using in-depth engineering skills and knowledge to solve difficult development problems and achieve engineering goals. Determine and source appropriate data for a given analysis. Work with data modelers/analysts to understand the business problems they are trying to solve then create or augment data assets to feed their analysis. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Creates technical documentation (internal) using understanding of internal business areas and processes as well as working knowledge of database design, data manipulation, ETL, implementation, information storage & retrieval and data flow & analysis.
Preemptively recognize and resolve technical issues utilizing knowledge of policies and processes.
Optimize data sources and processing rules to ensure appropriate data quality of all products utilizing trouble-shooting, design and development skills along with cross systems technical knowledge.
Solves critical issues and shares knowledge such as trends, aggregate, quantity volume regarding specific data sources.
Acts as a subject matter expert in one or more technical areas; such as data architecture, data engineering or data manipulation within big data systems like Hadoop and SQL.
Serves as a team leader within a work group or on cross-functional teams; accepts team lead stretch assignments, acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Presents to broader senior leadership team. Understands other business units and how they affect the team and work.
Acts as a liaison between business owners and technical associates to ensure the data collected and processed is both actionable and relevant to the end goals.
Determines appropriateness of data for storage and optimum storage organization. Determines how tables relate to each other and how fields interact within the tables to develop relational models.
Collaborates with technology and platform management partners to optimize data sourcing and processing rules to ensure appropriate data quality.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Come to work on Comcast’s best product, our Customer Experience. We are using Big Data and Machine Learning technologies to create proactive problem resolution for our customers. This is only possible by managing petabytes of system data and creating a world class platform to create predictions for the tens of millions of customers that we serve. The Culture of Comcast’s Technology and Product organization: • We have a bias for action and outcomes • We are agile and seek continuous improvement • We take our work seriously but don’t take ourselves too seriously • We are passionate about winning together This position designs and develops updated infrastructure in support of one or more business processes. Helps to ensure a balance between tactical and strategic technology solutions. Considers business problems “end-to-end”, including people, process, and technology, both within and outside the enterprise, as part of any design solution. Identifies and drives issues through closure. This role brings to bear significant cloud experience in the private and public cloud space as well as big data and software engineering. This role will be key in the re-platforming of the CX Personalization program in support of wholesale requirements. This person will engage as part of software delivery teams and contribute to several strategic efforts that drive personalized customer experiences across product usage, support interactions and customer journeys. This supports the building of real-time big data platforms, machine learning algorithms and data services that enable proactive responses for customers at every critical touch point.
Job Description
Our Product and Engineering team practices iterative development and continuous deployment. We work in small teams and keep our projects short and focused. Engineers rotate between projects and areas of the product to learn and take on new challenges. As a member of our Engineering team at MLX,you'll be given substantial feature ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute product ideas as well as code. You will be responsible for collaborating within the engineering team and with stakeholders. You can expect to:
Build and maintain features in our platform ranging from distributed data processing systems to in-browser data visualization tools.
Work with teammates to identify challenging product and engineering problems and then come up with elegant solutions.
5+ years of experience working in a software development environment, including full-time, hands-on application software development experience
Ability to work as part of a team of developers and with the testing groups while also successfully managing individual tasks and projects with minimal guidance
Keen attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills that facilitate teamwork and interaction with colleagues and internal clients
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Object Oriented Language like Java, C++ or C#
Spark, Flink or NiFi
OracleDB, Hadoop, Redis, Cassandra, Druid Neo4J, Neptune
Cloud technology experience with AWS or similar
5+ years of experience working in a software development environment, including full-time, hands-on application software development experience
Ability to work as part of a team of developers and with the testing groups while also successfully managing individual tasks and projects with minimal guidance
Keen attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills that facilitate teamwork and interaction with colleagues and internal clients

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Analytics and Experimentation (AXP) in the Comcast Applied AI & Discovery organization is looking for a Principal Data Engineer to help design, implement, improve on our Cloud Architecture, and collaborate on Data Platform and Comcast Product initiative and enhancements. The AXP Data Engineering team’s mission is to empower our Product & Engineering partners helping them make the data-driven decisions that drive customer value through improvements to the Connected Living and Entertainment products. To accomplish this, our team performs the data ingestion and transformation for various Comcast apps and device data to make them available within the Cloud Architecture. We make use of technologies like Spark, Presto, Scala, Python, various AWS Services in our ETL pipelines to expose the data to our analysts, product domain experts and machine learning applications. 2022 and beyond will be the year of data for the AXP Org and we are looking for someone to help us with various Cloud Platform and Data Pipelines initiatives. This is a hands-on job for a “big data” engineer. The job requires both serious technical chops and effective communication skills. Candidate will help to promote the use of industry and company technology standards while ensuring a balance between tactical and strategic technology solutions. Following standard PR review process and following the best practices regarding coding and architectural guidelines are expected. Coding and development with our CI/CD pipeline tools will be critical to the operations, testing and automation.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Ensures solutions are well engineered, operable, maintainable, and delivered on schedule.
Expertise in DevOps and Infrastructure as it relates to AWS Infrastructure and various AWS Services.
Utilize the various AWS Services (Kinesis, Lambda, S3, Athena, SQS, IAM etc) to provision Data Pipes.
Design and Manage the API endpoints, and complex Data Pipelines in distributed environment.
Involved in ETL utilizing Spark, Scala, Python on Databricks for Data Engineering and Architecture.
Utilize Data Analysis skills, Looker and Spark framework for aggregations and BI Analytical requirements.
Develop data models and mappings.
Perform exploratory data analysis on existing products and datasets (both unstructured and structured).
Implement the design and develop tools that automatically detect data anomalies, enabling Product Analysts and engineers to easily build/manage their own ETLs.
He/ She will work closely with our Client Development Teams, Platform engineering team, and AI teams to manage all stages of the data pipeline.
Experience with experimentation A/B Testing Data Pipes and managing KPIs is nice-to-have.
Monitors current and future trends, technology and information that will positively affect organizational projects; applies and integrates emerging technological trends to new and existing systems architecture.
Contributes to the overall system implementation strategy for the enterprise and participates in appropriate forums, meetings, presentations etc. to meet goals.
We are looking for someone with a strong sense of responsibility: taking pride in your work, leveraging others, owning the problem.

Engineers are responsible for assisting with the architecture design, and We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Engineering and Operations team. Engineers are responsible for assisting with the architecture design and building the ETL pipeline of our master data assets. Our tech stack includes Spark, Python, Databricks, Kubernetes, AWS, MinIO, Teradata and Airflow. An ideal candidate has 3-6 years of experience in building Big Data pipelines, has experience with spark and has strong SQL skills. We are a highly collaborative team; we partner with our data stewards and architects to design optimized data solutions that are generally available company-wide, leveraged by our team of analysts, and feed dashboards built by our reporting team. Candidates should be self-directed and comfortable moving between multiple projects as needs change. If you are looking to grow your technical expertise, and gain experience in leading and developing junior team members we would like to hear from you.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities

Supports the architecture, design, development, qualification and deployment of applications consistent with product and technical roadmaps.

Works with engineering project management and principle engineers to deliver applications that meet or exceed product requirements, project schedules and reliability.

Develops and applies performance and bandwidth models for interactive applications to document network impacts.

Works with the product development and operations teams to define technical requirements to accompany existing product and operation requirements. Designs and develops use cases in support of the technical requirements. Transforms technical requirements into architectures.

Defines and documents a detailed design to meet technical requirements and architecture.

Assists in vendor technical selection and management including input to specifications and vendor evaluation. Interfaces with outside teams in the development of internal and third party software to support the detailed designs.

Interfaces with Company test teams to validate Company test plans and procedures are representative of fully exercising and validating the product features and capabilities.

Works closely with development, integration and test teams to ensure product quality. Prepares deliverables for trial and market readiness.

Drives the continuous improvement of deployed systems by consistently looking for ways to reduce costs and improve efficiency.

Supports operations by providing deployment and sustained engineering support for all responsible systems and technologies. Diagnoses and resolves escalated field issues.

Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s ) and overtime as necessary.

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Job Summary Timeline is a Customer Data Platform that collects large volumes of high-value data to provide the best customer experience possible. Timeline begins with a self-service platform named Elements to onboard events and profiles, ingests the data through multiple interfaces, presents information in a 360-degree view of the customer, analytical reporting, and numerous other tools to support Comcast customers. As an Engineer 4, candidate will be responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new applications. Oversees the documentation of all development activity. Assist with supervising performance metrics. Has in-depth experience, knowledge, and skills in own subject area. Usually settles own work priorities. Integrate knowledge of business and functional priorities. It is strongly encouraged that you participate in Comcast events, discussions, and organizations throughout the company to lift Timeline and Comcast up together Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. Leads teams or projects and shares expertise.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Responsible for maintaining and developing scalable functionality for the systems that pull customer experience data.
Design and develop distributed, scalable, and fault-tolerant software applications to meet business requirements by using Java and Python.
Utilize Kafka, Kinesis, Terraform and AWS cloud to create software architecture and leads design solutions that improve the customer experience
Leverage Agile methodologies and the software development lifecycle to deliver products in a timely manner
Maintain and support products and platforms to minimize downtime and prevent customer impacts.
Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications.
Researches, writes, and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Reviews literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and mentorship with regards to practices, procedures, and techniques. Serves as a guide and mentor for junior-level Software Development Engineers.
Gain deep knowledge of our platform, implement best practices and processes, and leads the team with eliminating technical debt.
Work with our tech stack and tooling which includes, but is not limited to: Java, Python, AWS, Concourse, Terraform
Displays in-depth knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills, and their application in specified engineering specialty.
Displays knowledge of and ability to apply, project management skills.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent, and punctual attendance. Ability to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as vital.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Experience developing in Java/ Python
Experience with AWS cloud
Experience with REST Web services
Experience with Git
Understanding of Microservice design
Understanding of Terraform
Understanding of Containerization

Come to work on Comcast’s best product, our Customer Experience. We are using Big Data and Machine Learning technologies to create proactive problem resolution for our customers. This is only possible by managing petabytes of system data and creating a world class platform to create predictions for the tens of millions of customers that we serve. The Culture of Comcast’s Technology and Product organization: • We have a bias for action and outcomes • We are agile and seek continuous improvement • We take our work seriously but don’t take ourselves too seriously • We are passionate about winning together This position designs and develops updated infrastructure in support of one or more business processes. Helps to ensure a balance between tactical and strategic technology solutions. Considers business problems “end-to-end”, including people, process, and technology, both within and outside the enterprise, as part of any design solution. Identifies and drives issues through closure. This role brings to bear significant cloud experience in the private and public cloud space as well as big data and software engineering. This role will be key in the re-platforming of the CX Personalization program in support of wholesale requirements. This person will engage as part of software delivery teams and contribute to several strategic efforts that drive personalized customer experiences across product usage, support interactions and customer journeys. This supports the building of real-time big data platforms, machine learning algorithms and data services that enable proactive responses for customers at every critical touch point.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services."

Job Summary
Responsible for transforming large, complex data into consumable business databases and applications for self-service analytics and reporting. Create system architecture, design and specification using in-depth engineering skills and knowledge to solve difficult development problems and achieve engineering goals. Determine and source appropriate data for a given analysis. Work with data modelers/analysts to understand the business problems they are trying to solve then create or augment data assets to feed their analysis. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.

Analytics and Experimentation (AXP) in the Comcast Applied AI & Discovery organization is looking for a Principal Data Engineer to help design, implement, improve on our Cloud Architecture, and collaborate on Data Platform and Comcast Product initiative and enhancements. The AXP Data Engineering team’s mission is to empower our Product & Engineering partners helping them make the data-driven decisions that drive customer value through improvements to the Connected Living and Entertainment products. To accomplish this, our team performs the data ingestion and transformation for various Comcast apps and device data to make them available within the Cloud Architecture. We make use of technologies like Spark, Presto, Scala, Python, various AWS Services in our ETL pipelines to expose the data to our analysts, product domain experts and machine learning applications. 2022 and beyond will be the year of data for the AXP Org and we are looking for someone to help us with various Cloud Platform and Data Pipelines initiatives. This is a hands-on job for a “big data” engineer. The job requires both serious technical chops and effective communication skills. Candidate will help to promote the use of industry and company technology standards while ensuring a balance between tactical and strategic technology solutions. Following standard PR review process and following the best practices regarding coding and architectural guidelines are expected. Coding and development with our CI/CD pipeline tools will be critical to the operations, testing and automation.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Learning Analytics
Job_Description:
Effectv, the advertising sales division of Comcast Cable, helps local, regional and national advertisers use the best of digital with the power of TV to grow their business. It provides multi-screen marketing solutions to make advertising campaigns more effective and easier to execute. Headquartered in New York with offices throughout the country, Effectv has a presence in 66 markets with nearly 35 million owned and represented subscribers. We’re dedicated to helping our clients meet their business goals by connecting them with their customers through multiscreen television advertising. Working with companies from local startups to nationwide corporations, we provide support to help each business reach its target customers. By applying data to television advertising in new ways, we’re able to bring our clients the best of digital media, coupled with the power of TV. To learn more, check out www.effectv.com.
Job Summary We are seeking a Sr Analyst, Learning Analytics professional to lead analytics and reporting capabilities in the Learning & Performance (L&P) function. In this role you will be a pioneer in driving the application of data, analytics, and visualization techniques to assess and strengthen Effectv’s organizational proficiency, business performance and learning investments. Analytics Strategy & Execution: you will be empowered to develop an approach for data modeling, collection, and analysis. You will develop and execute an approach for collecting data across various platforms, tools and sources. Using your model, you will drive learning analytics by using statistical analysis techniques to identify insights and trends in talent competencies, skills, and business performance. You will partner with L&P’s Instructional Designers to design, develop, or examine pre, intra, and post-course assessment questions. It will be critical in this role to create a link between organizational competency and business KPIs. Performance Reporting Strategy & Execution: you will be empowered to develop an approach for organizational competency and business performance reporting. You will implement methods for visualizing data and analysis and collaborate with the Learning Business Partner to enable Business Leaders in decision-making to drive talent, team, and business KPIs. You will create standard frameworks and templates for consistent and impactful reporting across business areas. L&P is part of the Strategic Operations team which drives Effectv’s Company Operating Plan efforts, and this position will report directly to the Senior Director, Learning & Performance. An ideal candidate for the L&P function is agile and intellectually curious, able to influence and provide thought leadership in their domain of Learning expertise while effectively navigating ambiguity and driving business outcomes with a learner-centric mindset. Additionally, you will build outstanding and constructive working relationships with key stakeholders, and foster an inclusive environment.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities

Demonstrated analytics experience; ability to analyze and synthesize both quantitative and qualitative data from multiple sources to identify themes and develop compelling recommendations. Strong analytical skills and ability to identify and present data-driven insights and trends. Strong critical thinking ability to identify interdependencies between issues, data, and outcomes. Proven ability to communicate ideas and insights in person, virtually, and in writing, succinctly and with impact, understanding what is relevant vs. what is "noise" to audiences at all management levels

Demonstrated experience presenting and translating quantitative analysis to senior or executive leadership. Ability to socialize and adapt our learning value story to leaders at all levels of the organization

Demonstrated consultation and presentation skills, specifically with recommending performance measurement and evaluation approaches. Established track record for taking a consultative approach to developing and driving a measurement & reporting strategy to positively impact business KPIs

Project Management experience in successfully conceptualizing, planning, managing, delivering, and monitoring multiple, concurrent, and complex workstreams in a matrixed organization with aggressive timelines

understands the strategic business needs of the company and the impact of learning on meeting the development needs of employees to best serve our customers; leverages external marketplace research and business insights to drive outcomes

builds outstanding and constructive working relationships with key stakeholders and business leaders at all levels across the organization, as well with peers and colleagues; organizationally savvy with a learner centric mindset; desires to collaborate and successfully operates across the organization

focuses on creating an environment of honesty, inclusion, and respect for others; champions differing ideas and perspectives; embraces a creative, innovative approach to developing employees with a strong appreciation of our diverse employee and customer base

Summary of Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in the field of Data & Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Human Capital Analytics or related field

5+ years of proficiency in data-related tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Apache Spark, Microsoft Excel, etc.

5+ years of experience in Programming Languages such as SQL

5+ years of end-to-end Project Management experience with ability to drive project activities even when resources are limited

Advertising industry a plus or high drive to quickly learn the industry and demonstrate value within the first 90 days in role

Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Regular, consistent, and punctual attendance.

Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.

Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.

Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.

Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.

Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.

Drive results and growth.

Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.

Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Learning Analytics
Job_Description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
Job Summary Responsible for a variety of programs involving business reengineering efforts that support our Talent & Learning Organization. Works with a cross-functional team across headquarters and our divisions as well as COEs to idetnify and track KPIs, gather data to drive insights, and create opportunities for action. Works to define KPIs to track and measure our goals for our processes that support the employee journey, including, but not limited to: Talent Acquisition, Learning & Development, Creer Growth & Performance, Marketing & Branding, Vendor Management, DE&I, and more. Help to craft the future state that will be enabled through technology. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Leads analysis and design of existing and new business processes that span multiple areas of the organization
Develops scalable processes to support and benefit the employee journey.
Deconstructs technical concepts and metrics to facilitate process development.
Helps to define success metrics for each new system or process and establishes a plan to track, monitor and measure the success of those metrics.
Completes assessments of business processes and documents each of the following areas: problem statements, process flows, gap analyses and solution recommendations.
Develops repeatable and thus scalable, plans and processes in order to speed time to market and improve operational efficiency.
Interacts closely with matrixed cross-functional teams (both field and corporate) in order to secure alignment.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Learning Analytics
Job_Description:
Data & Telecommunications Analyst Job Summary
Are you looking to take your analyst job to the next level? We have an awesome opportunity with years of career growth ahead of you. As part of the Data & Telecommunications analyst team, responsible for overseeing technical expertise to ensure that voice communications are sufficient, appropriate, functioning and performing at optimum and cost-effective levels. Determines causes of systems malfunctions and directs or performs corrective actions. May solve highly technical complex problems and be called on to consult for other projects. Viewed as a Subject Matter Expert within the organization. Acts as a technical specialist within own area. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.

Job Summary Responsible for working cross-functionally to collect business intelligence requirements; develops conceptual data models, design, build, and test sets of reporting and analytic business intelligence programs. Develops processes and procedures to drive department efficiencies. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. Develops business requirements, assesses current reporting capabilities, and makes recommendations for improvement.
Creates actionable insight and understanding, through the analysis of both quantitative and qualitative data, building recommendations that directly address business objectives.
Serves as a team leader within a work group or on cross-functional teams; accepts team lead stretch assignments. Leads discussions and presentations of results, recommendations, and business insights to broader senior leadership team.

Acts as a subject matter expert in one or more data subject areas such as product, sales, call center, network operation, and financial data.
Participates in defining business intelligence requirements for projects and data requests.
Participates in multiple large-scale projects by providing data analysis to project leaders.
Trains others throughout the organization in using key analytical and forecasting tools and statistical analysis.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Learning Analytics
Job_Description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
Job Summary This role will be responsible for being the conduit between various cross-functional teams to bridge the gap between the needs defined by business stakeholders and technical development teams.
Job Description

Core Responsibilities:
Partner with marketing team to fully understand and contextualize business problems and opportunities (discovery, requirements gathering), then subsequently facilitate the end-to-end process through delivery on associated data operations (architecture, integration, engineering) contingencies.

Fully define user stories that refine the complex business problem into a way that technical teams can both understand and leverage, enabling efficient hand-offs and hedging bottlenecks or development risks.

Continually collaborate with HQ and division marketing and finance leads, as well as business intelligence practice to understand how the associated data project(s) adheres to the broader Marketing reporting and analytics roadmap, itemizing specific opportunities to help shape and influence a more scalable and sustainable analytics environment.

Act as residential marketing data subject matter expert in broader initiatives with external domains (Enterprise Business Intelligence, Sales, Finance, etc.) and help foster knowledge transfers and system/platform requirements to bridge disparate business requirements.


Bachelor’s or Master’s in Information Systems, Marketing/Data/Business Analytics, or related discipline is required.

Knowledge, ideally experience with big data, data modeling, and data mart designing.

Strong knowledge of SQL and at least one of business intelligence/reporting platforms (including but not limited to: Tableau, Domo, ThoughtSpot, etc.) is required.

Experienced with data modeling tools like Erwin, PowerDesigner, ER Studio is required.

Medium to advanced level SQL knowledge is required.

Familiarity of data modeling standards and best practice are required.

Knowledge of Kimball dimensional modeling techniques.

Demonstrated experience in translating high-level business objectives and strategic imperatives to refined, actionable systems development requirements, as well as the ability to break down complex technical jargon into business context; this person should be able to speak sales speak to the business and tech speak to developers.

Experience with Teradata, AWS, and Hadoop is strongly preferred.

Certification in any data warehouse tools or technologies is preferred.


Demonstrated ability to lead and champion end-to-end data project workflow.

Basic knowledge, ideally working experience with marketing and sales operations and reporting.

Strong communications skills with experience working with cross-functional teams.

Advanced technical design and problem-solving skills with the demonstrated ability to effectively learn new business tools and processes.

Self-motived and works at a high-level independently, even with limited or ambiguous requirements/direction.

Project Management/knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC).

Exposure to agile development methodology will be helpful, but not required.


In partnership with various stakeholders from marketing, sales, and finance teams, develop a strong understanding of how to provide reporting and analytics to support marketing performance measurement and strategy planning needs. This candidate will either have to lead or be a very strong and active participate in influencing how key deliverables are thought through and delivered on (short, medium, and long-term).

Supporting business-unit specific stakeholder engagements and prioritization discussions from a data operations perspective, helping the business and reporting/analytics teams understand feasible solutions to pursue and explore.

Review the existing data and reporting project pipelines alongside the existing ecosystem to proactively make recommendations on how to better build, integrate, deploy, and democratize residential marketing data across the enterprise.

Lead and facilitate standing up a data stewardship framework (business glossaries, placemats, demonstrations) and evangelizing the utilization of our various data marts across all audience types (executives, leadership, and analysts).

Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Bachelor’s Degree in Analytics, Business Intelligence, Information Systems, or related field

Generally requires 5-8 years related experience.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Learning Analytics
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary Responsible for defining business intelligence requirements for individual subject areas; develops conceptual data models, design, build and test sets of reporting and analytic business intelligence programs. Works cross-functionally to collect data and makes actionable recommendations at all levels. Infers trends from a variety of data sources and confidently delivers their interpretation; makes recommendations to executives. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Performs all business intelligence analysis and data exploitation. Extracts signals and signatures from raw data, integrates that information with other data sources and compiles/disseminates formatted reports to customers.
Recommends improvements to competitive business intelligence reports and interpretation of data by sales, business development, product and executive committees.
Responsible for data analysis, insights, and reporting across OKRs, process improvement, performance, operations, finance, HR .
Capacity to see and grasp the big picture while executing tactically with quantitative and analytical rigor.
Proficient and resourceful running analyses requested by senior leadership to support decision-making .
Proficient in statistical modeling, financial modeling, trend analysis, forecasting, projections.
Experience integrating various data sources into analyses.
Proficient in software-based dashboards e.g. Tableau reporting and Excel, Visio, etc.
Fast learner, grasps concepts quickly, synthesizes information, analyzes data, AND partners with Design & Dynamics teammatestocommunicate data, insights, and takeaways clearly for various stakeholders via oral, written, and presentation formats.
Plans and executes system testing. Requires knowledge of the customer's mission and technology used to accomplish a given task.
Leads the analysis and reconciliation of data and reporting projects and initiatives delivery.
Develops, maintains and reports all relevant product, site and customer metrics and applies findings to develop appropriate goals and projections.
Trains others throughout the organization in using key analytical and forecasting tools and statistical analysis.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Ability to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as vital.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
